<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> "All power be to the eternal reign of the Netheril Empire. Let none pull asunder our collective knowledge and might."
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> <StartAction>[Though you discern that the writing is some form of instructions, you cannot make out its meaning.]</Start>
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> "All power be to the eternal reign of the Netheril Empire. Let none pull asunder our collective knowledge and might."
"Cast forth your magics, that they should gather herein and be magnified. Call upon those most protective of spells and draw them into the orb."
"Therein shall our most impressive arts be shown."
<StartAction>[Leave the pillar alone.]</Start>
<StartCheck>[Decipher Script]</Start> <StartAction>[Attempt to translate the runes.]</Start>
<StartCheck>[Lore]</Start> <StartAction>[Attempt to translate the runes.]</Start>
Grr, yevoni da siveren kintai?
I would really rather you did not attempt to do that. I would hate to have to kill the one who saved me. Would you care to converse in your common tongue instead?
Then so be it. If the burden of existence lies so heavy upon you, I shall relieve you of it.
My apologies, <race> one. The shock of my transition from stone to flesh caused me to revert to my native tongue. May I be so presumptuous as to ask the name of my benefactor?
A bit paranoid? Well, as you wish. I will give you my name as a gift, for rescuing me. But do not worry, I have something else to offer as well.
I am Myrixamophit. I imagine that such a name is hard on your tongue, so if you wish, you may call me Myr.
Pleasant to meet you, <FirstName>. I am Myrixamophit. I imagine that such a name is hard on your tongue, so if you wish, you may call me Myr.
Did you have much trouble annihilating those marauding lizards with their petrifying gaze?
I believe the expression you are looking for is "as easy as pie", but it is of no matter. I am glad you were able to defeat them so handily. I am impressed, and I do not easily impress.
Of course <he/she> is impressive. <FirstName> is the hero of great ballads. The companion to Deekin, the... most fabuloust bard ever!
Fabuloust is not even a word, little kobold. Between the two of you I think I am getting a headache!
Obviously you had less trouble than I did, so I am impressed, and I do not easily impress.

I am afraid that my lair is in terrible disrepair, so I have none of the proper amenities to entertain guests. I can offer you answers to any questions you might have, or we can play a rousing good game of riddles.
Oh, and I do have a reward for you, if you are interested. I think you would appreciate the magical device that makes power stones.
And I shall be leaving as well. It is time to find myself a new lair. Maybe I shall head back south and see if any of my relatives still live.
You are a very strange creature. Good luck in your adventures.
And to you also, friend.
Excellent. I shall think on this for a second. I want to come up with a good one, not just that boring old riddle about legs and aging.
Oh, I have one. This is fairly easy, but a good start. "If I eat, I grow; If I drink, I die. By my life you live; in my life you cry."
Excellent. A piece of advice when making your power stone: Six Belladonna roots combined in the offensive urn will hasten your step. I always liked to move quickly in a fight.
Let us try a harder riddle.
Excellent. I see you have some competence when it comes to intellectual tasks. That was an easy logical problem, so let's try something a little harder.
"Without me, you would crawl; with me you stand tall; too much of me and you fall."

A perfect answer; well thought out indeed. I think you would appreciate the offensive power of the power stone when ten organs from extra-planar creatures are used in the right urn. But, one more riddle.
A perfect answer; well thought out indeed. Again you impress me. I think we should try one more riddle, and then life will have to go on.
I saw a battle between griffons and hippogryphs. Each race had male and female members involved in the battle. Each member of both races attacked every member of the other race once.
When a male griffon attacked a male hippogryph, they would swipe with their claws. When a male and a female fought, or two females fought each other, they would bite.
I witnessed 21 pairs swipe, while 34 pairs bit each other. How many male creatures and how many female creatures were fighting?
I know that the males and females cannot be even in number. I am pretty sure that there are more males than females.
You are indeed a knowledgeable <man/woman>. That was great fun, and I wish I had time for you to share some riddles with me, but I do need to start looking for a new home.
Is there anything else I might do for you?
Deekin thinks... maybe the hero should think again? Deekin is almost positive that there be more girls than boys in big fight.
Um... and maybe when sphinx is done, he tells Deekin details of battle? Maybe Deekin makes a song about it.
Xanos does not have the answer yet, but I am sure that there must be more males than females in this fight.
I am sorry, but that is incorrect. Ah well, life goes on and I need to find a new home. Do you have any questions before I leave?
No, but a decent try. Still, I suppose that should be enough riddles for now. If you have questions, I will answer them.
The answer is fire. Drinking would not kill the others.
A foolish and disappointing answer. An imp could have guessed better. I will waste no more time with you. If you have questions, I will answer them.
I feel obligated to answer any questions you have. What would you ask?
What shall we do now?
Apparently there is a crystal ball near the portal that shows which button must be pressed next.
The problem with this system, at least according to the maker of the crystal ball, is that the architects of the portal room made each room with a button look exactly the same.
I would assume that were you to find a way to distinguish each room, you could figure out the proper pattern for activation.
I know that I was turned to stone for a while, and I have not had the time for proper grooming, or even just to look in a mirror, but perhaps you could answer a question for me?
Did someone come along while I was a statue and paint the word, "GULLIBLE" on my forehead?
No I will not go fight some powerful extra-planar creatures just minutes after being turned to flesh! Thank you very much.
I never could fit through the diminutive hidden door, so I could hardly launch an expedition into the ruins myself. There was a journal in this room, which I read, though I no longer see it.
Stupid basilisks probably ate it. Anyways, it was the journal of a Netherese mage who was doing research and creating traps to protect the portal.
Although I doubt it still exists, he did mention an orb, which would absorb three defensive spells and then turn into a magical staff. The staff could then cast all three back on you at once.
He seems to have liked spheres, because he created a magic ball that could help activate the portal.
I flew here several years ago, looking for a home. There was a crack in the ground, so I landed to inspect if it was a cave. The earth crumbled under my feet and I fell into this ancient ruin.

When I regained my feet, if not my dignity, I looked around and decided that this would make a perfect lair. I cast a spell to keep out unwanted company and began to rearrange this part of the ruin as my new home.
It was only after I moved in that I discovered the existence of the secret door leading out into the rest of the ruin, but the door was too small for me to fit through, so I simply left it alone.

Actually the basilisks got in the same way I did. I was out hunting and came back dragging a nice, freshly-killed camel. I was so happy with my burden that I didn't even notice that more of the rock had fallen in.
I heard the hiss of one of the creatures and noticed the rock on the floor. I backed slowly towards the wall, hoping to get into a better defensive position, and then I looked at my foes.
The last thing I remember is a pair of green eyes. I am thinking that if the roof might continue to collapse, I will want to be moving. Anything else?
I can sense that you have already used the power stone device, so I guess that takes care of your reward.
Of course. You might have already discovered the apparatus in the next room, or not, but I sense that it still works, so you have not used it yet.
I studied the device for quite a while, intending to use it myself. Unfortunately I could never actually decide what the most useful combination of powers might be.
As a reward, I will tell you how to operate this bit of Netherese magic to create a power stone of great power.
There are two urns. The one on the right is for choosing an offensive power for your stone. The one on the left is to choose a defensive power.
The trick is, you have to have the right number of each component in both urns before it will work. Once you are ready, just use the device and it will make your stone.
The components are listed on the pillars around the room. Each pillar will tell you about the number and type of components you need for a power.
I plan on relocating as soon as we are done conversing, so if you have anything else you wish to say or ask, please do so now.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> I think not. The power stone is a powerful item, casting defensive and offensive spells simultaneously. Your bullying tactics are distasteful.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> I find your bullying tactics distasteful, to say the least. Take this ruby and we are done with each other.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> I think not. The power stone is a powerful item, casting defensive and offensive spells simultaneously. To ask for more is pure greed.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> I suppose you are right. I can give you this ruby. I was saving it for use in the power stone device, but I never found enough for what I wanted.
I am certain you can figure that out on your own; just read the inscriptions on the pillars. Things like belladonna roots and rubies.
It is hardly my fault that you ruined my surprise by using the powerful Netheril magic. It took me quite some time to figure out exactly what you had to do to make it work.
I could have helped you maximize the powers of the stone, had you freed me sooner.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> I think not. The power stone is a powerful item, casting defensive and offensive spells simultaneously. Your bullying tactics are distasteful.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> I find your bullying tactics distasteful, to say the least. Take this ruby and we are done with each other.
I think it is time I go and look for a new lair. Goodbye, foul-humored <race> wretch.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> I think not. The power stone is a powerful item, casting defensive and offensive spells simultaneously. To ask for more is pure greed.

<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> I suppose you are right. I can give you this ruby. I was saving it for use in the power stone device, but I never found enough for what I wanted. I guess you can sell it.
And now that the unpleasantness is dealt with, what should we do?
A pleasant and agreeable suggestion. What should we do now?
Oh, you are as bad as Drogan's little faerie dragon, Riisi. The annoying creature never stops with the riddles!
Are you calling me annoying!
Uh... no, Xanos was calling Riisi annoying. I am sure that your riddles will be far superior to hers.
And where would this faerie dragon live?
Small village called Hilltop. Little school belongs to a dwarf. You need not keep baring your fangs at Xanos that way! Just resume your conversation with my friend now.
I apolo... I mean, I am sorry. I was asking if the basilisks gave you much trouble?
<StartAction>[Sigh.]</Start> I simply asked for your name.
I am leaving now, unless you have something else you needed?
Stupid beast. I guess I shall have to kill you too!
No, I'd rather just kill you.
I guess so.
Great. I suppose if we can't communicate you won't be offering me a reward.
What does that mean?
I have no idea what you just said.
I don't like to share my name.
I am <FullName>. What is your name?
My name is <FirstName>. Who are you?
Yes, it was a close battle.
I have never had such a close brush with death.
They were easy as cake.
Not much.
I'll be going now.
Looking for some cute sphinx cousins?
Wait. If you are leaving then I have more questions.
Good luck.
I enjoy riddles.
Memory.
Fire.
Alcohol.
Memory.
Life.
Pride.
Eight males and eight females.
Ten males and six females.
Six males and ten females.
Seven males and nine females.
Nine males and seven females.
Water.
Legs.
Water.
Sand.
Light.
Darkness.
I have some questions.
That is all the questions I have.
How do I activate the portal?
How did you learn this?
Could you help me defeat the slaadi that have invaded these ruins?
Do you know anything about these ruins?
Did he say anything else?
Why are you here?
How foolish! You should have sealed the door against intruders.
I bet when you saw the basilisks you wished you'd sealed it too.
Is that how the basilisks got in?
We need to discuss my reward.
That's a start. How do I make the stone?
That sounds promising. How does it work?
I guess I will go try that then.
<StartCheck>[Persuade - Intimidate]</Start> You will give me a better reward or you will find that being stone was a much kinder fate.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> I think I deserve more than that for saving your life.
What are the components?
<StartCheck>[Persuade - Intimidate]</Start> You will give me a better reward or you will find that being stone was a much kinder fate.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> I think I deserve more than this.
Fine, let's talk about something else.
Please use smaller words.
Huh? You are still speaking common, right?

It appears this rock face could be ascended into the ruins above, though not without some risk of injury from falling.
<StartAction>Step away.</Start>
<StartCheck>[Dexterity]</Start> <StartAction>Climb the boulder.</Start>
<StartAction>[The formian chitters and points towards a unique-looking formian across the room, bowing obsequiously.]</Start>
The formian chitters and waves its arms angrily at the audacity of the slaadi intruders.
The formian chitters and cheers at the brilliant battle you fought.
The formian chitters and bows to you in appreciation of your assistance.
The formian taps its foot impatiently, waiting for an opportunity to attack something else.
The formian chitters and does a little dance, apparently enjoying its time with you.
The formian salutes you and chitters happily. It is possible that the queen is giving life and energy to her formidable soldier.
<StartAction>[The formian chitters and points further on down the tunnel, bowing obsequiously.]</Start>
<StartHighlight>[You hear a disembodied voice sound inside your head.]</Start> Invader! We shall destroy you! We are not weak!
<StartHighlight>[You hear the eerie voice echo inside your head.]</Start> We sense you are not one of the creatures of chaos that invades us from above. Who are you?
<StartHighlight>[The voice inside your head sounds shaken and confused.]</Start> You are not what we expected. You do not answer our queries.
<StartHighlight>[You hear the strange voice sounding again in your head.]</Start> Join us, stranger. The hive will no longer harm you. Come and speak with us.
<StartHighlight>[You hear the strange voice sounding again in your head.]</Start> You kill us and this weakens you. We should work together to destroy a common enemy. Find me.
<StartHighlight>[The formian's juvenile queen looks at you and her voice slides uneasily into your mind.]</Start>
Peaceful stranger, sad day you come to us, but still pleasant outcomes are possible. We offer you truce and assist you against chaos creatures.
We were more, with greatest mind, the hive queen. Then come the chaos foes. They tear and crush and destroy us. They kill the greatest mind. Now we are queen, though we are not ready.
Sad day, evil stranger.
We do battle against chaos foes who invade the hive. You are strong, we see that now.
You do battle with chaos foes, we see this too. We and you fight chaos foe together, both be stronger.
You agree to go out of hive and fight chaos foe, we give you song crystal. With this we come and fight chaos foe with you.
Just one use has the song of crystal. Use when need is greatest, when chaos foes be strongest, we will be there.
When chaos foe is strong against you, send thoughts to crystal. Crystal will give song and call to us, and we will be there. Very quickly can hive be there for you.
Joyous is this day, when two strangers join together to destroy chaos foes. Here is crystal. When our hive you leave, we repair walls. You not able return, none return.
Long will this day be remembered in our mind. Go make war for peace, hive friend.
An army of these creatures for our own use. That ought to help us fight these bloody slaadi.
Joyous is this day, when three strangers join together to destroy chaos foes. Here is crystal. When our hive you leave, we repair walls. You not able return, none return.
I assume this creature is communicating with you through telepathy. That would make ruling your subjects much easier.
Ummm... boss? Who you talks to?
Okay, Deekin be quiet. But if you goes crazy, you lets Deekin know first, okay?
Very difficult it is to understand what you mean. This is how we speak. This is our way. Without thoughts, your words mean nothing to us.
We are the hive. You are alone? Where is your hive? Strange creature with all your mind in one form! You are alien.
Though your form does repulse us, still we would work with you.
She says she likes me, so she has included me. What a strange feeling, to have someone in your mind, stealing your thoughts.
<StartHighlight>[The juvenile hive queen chitters but does not send you her thoughts.]</Start>
I am not interested in your offer. I am here to kill you.
What do you offer?
How often will you help me?
How do I use this crystal?
I agree. Let's work together.
Quiet, Deekin.
How do you speak to my mind?
Greetings. My name is <FirstName>.
The hall ahead does not appear to be safe. The ceiling itself seems precariously close to giving way and crushing anyone underneath it.
Oh, my. I ask it for its name, and it provides me mine, instead. So you *do* know who I am. That is good.
Now since you will not provide me a name, allow me a guess. Hmm... it is <FirstName>, is it not? One of the dwarf's apprentices?
And I see you have come to me alone. How unusually foolhardy.
Let us get down to business, shall we? I was expecting Drogan to make it through my trap alone, but it seems he kept the portal open for you, instead. Does that mean he is dead, then? A pity.
Fortunately you've brought me what I was waiting for, anyhow. What a delicious irony.
Not for you, specifically, but rather what you carried with you. Here... allow me to remove my hood, as it will explain much.
And there are others with you, as well. Hmmm. Ah, well, no matter.
And what's this creature you bring? A... a kobold? It... it *is* a kobold...
Deekin is bard to the great and mighty hero who will slay you! Umm... but Deekin mostly here for posterity reasons...
So I imagine...
Who else is this, then? A beardless dwarf woman. Surely you must be none other than Dorna.
I am. And you shall pay for what you have done this day, foul witch!
I see. A promise, is it? How amusing.
And who have we here? Only a half-orc, I see. Xanos, perhaps?
Bah! Xanos is "only" a half-orc as much as you seem "only" a sorceress!
Surprisingly perceptive. Have you other tricks in store for me, half-orc?
You shall see them soon enough, witch. <FirstName> and I are not here to chat.
Such sweet bravado to see in a <race> <man/woman>. How very full of rage you seem to me, it is quite interesting.
Such sweet bravado to see in an elven <man/woman>. How very full of rage you seem to me, it is quite interesting.
A proposal? <StartAction>[chuckle!]</Start> Indeed? How very interesting.
Stop me? Why, no, <FirstName>... that's not why you're here at all.
Let me guess... you're Heurodis?
You were waiting for me?
Never mind my name, witch! I am going to kill you!
Forget Drogan. My name is <FirstName>, and I have a proposal for you.
I am <FirstName>, and I am here to stop you.
<StartAction>[grumble... mumble...]</Start>
I hope they'll feed us in the camp tonight too, but there are no guarantees.
<StartAction>[grumble... mumble...]</Start>
I suppose the kobold will be leaving, so we won't be able to put him in the stew, now will we?
Yes, I suppose this is goodbye. But I am sure we will meet again. <FirstName> is a very resourceful person.
<StartAction>[grumble... mumble...]</Start>
No, no one expects you to weep and hug them goodbye. I'm sure they would find it quite scandalous, indeed.
Especially when <he/she> gots Deekin at <his/her> side!
No, I think you have been quite miserable enough to our friend. I don't think <he/she> likes you anymore.
<StartAction>[grumble... mumble...]</Start>
No, I don't like your attitude, either.
No, I don't know how they make the famous Aovian wine.
<StartAction>[grumble... mumble...]</Start>
Fermented camel what? Ick, that's disgusting, Birgen! You really aren't all that funny, you know?
Yes, I know brother, we have reached the land of sun-baked brains. These Ao followers are as crazy as you act, Birgen.
<StartAction>[grumble... mumble...]</Start>
Well, if you are going to use language like that, I'm just going to ignore you.
Why is it you never see a dwarven zombie?
<StartAction>[grumble... mumble...]</Start>
Ah, thick skull, difficult to reach the brains; good point, Birgen.
Whew! A half-orc in the hot sun, with no bathing facilities, not a good combination.
<StartAction>[grumble... mumble...]</Start>
Oh, and you think you're all roses? Good thing we get to bathe now.
Crimeny! This trip through the desert took a long time!
<StartAction>[grumble... mumble...]</Start>
Well, with your attitude, Mister Cranky, this trip always feels twice as long.
The last time we were here it was great. We had so much fun making up new worship songs about Ao.
<StartAction>[grumble... mumble...]</Start>
Well nobody could understand your lyrics, that's why they weren't singing them.
Well, take care of yourself out there, <FirstName>. Don't go doing anything crazy, like joining the Ao folk or anything. Good bye.
Yes, well... you were a big help to us back in Hilltop with Daschnaya. Not to mention getting us here in one piece.
There's few enough folk around who give us the time of day. So I truly thank you, <FirstName>. Maybe we'll travel together again.
I know that we were just doing the dwarf a favor, and I wasn't planning on paying you anything... but there's few enough folk who treat us as decently as you have.
So here... a little token from us to you. Use it in good health. Perhaps we'll travel together again, some day.
What would you like to know?
Tall, ugly, human scholar. Actually, in his crowd that could be quite a feat. That mostly describes every one of the archaeologist folk I remember.
Oh, he is male too, that should cut it down by say... two. Sorry, but I'm sure if you ask, somebody will direct you to him. Anything else?
They aren't a bad bunch, though there are a few with some very strange ideas. One of the priests likes to whip himself and... well, I don't care for it much, but to each his own.
I don't like to knock another person's religion, but any religion where the god couldn't care less about his followers... what can I say?
Anyways, that's all I have to say about them. Anything else?
Well, of course you can. You get the premium discount too.
Paid? I was thinking of asking you for some gold to cover all the food you ate. We're not wealthy, after all, and we took you and the others along as a favor to your mentor.
At any rate, you're here and here's where we agreed to take you. I will still allow you to buy some supplies at a good price, if you are interested.
I am eager to leave this caravan behind. Let's just call it even and part ways.
Your eagerness to leave would have nothing to do with your little visit to Torias's hidden cache last night, would it?
You know about... I mean, I have no idea what you are talking about.
I always know what is going on in my caravan; that's my job. I know all about Torias's little enterprise, and have known since the day he sold his first caltrops.
Xanos should charge you for the benefit of his accumulated wisdom, which I so willingly shared.
Ordering halflings around is not the same a sharing your wisdom. I ought to charge you for the use of my workers as your personal servants.
Ummm... you not wants to make Deekin pay, does you?
No, though it's tempting, considering the kind of cook you made. No offense.
Thank you, Katriana. Though I am pleased to be leaving now, I would not have cared to make this journey without your assistance.
No, the desert is no place to be on foot with no source of shade for rest stops. How the Bedine tolerate it is beyond me.
My only complaint... next time, please hire someone other than a kobold to do the cooking. Last night was...
Awful... yes. I have no idea what those meaty chunks were, and I really don't want to know.
Xanos acknowledges your thanks, but without my faithful companion, <FirstName>, there is a good chance I would have failed. Well... a small chance anyways.
There is a very good chance that without <FirstName> here, Xanos would have been smothered in his sleep for annoying everyone else.
How dare you insult Xanos this way?! I find your tiny caravan to be shoddy and your goods to be inferior!
Good thing <FirstName> controls your finances then. Now, if you will kindly stop interrupting...
Or without the boss's faithful kobold companion, Deekin!
True enough. I don't think I'll be hiring on any more kobolds to do the cooking, however.
Ummm... why not? Deekin likes to cook.
Well, I spent half of last night awake and belching uncontrollably from dinner... and I'm really too frightened to ask why that is.
Well, it all have to do with great, big --
No. Really. I don't *want* to know. Ever.
Best of luck in your journeys, <FirstName>. Is there anything you needed?
I guess I'll be going.
Can I ask you some questions?
How do I recognize Garrick?
What can you tell me about these Ao worshippers?
Can I see your goods?
Don't I get paid for helping your caravan get here?
Aye, so I guess you'll be off then, now that we're here. <StartAction>[Sigh.]</Start>
Oh, you say that now, but I know that you'll miss me before long. You were a fine, fine companion on this dreary trip. <StartAction>[Sigh.]</Start> I'm missing you already.
It's my only hope, really, that you might deign to satisfy one last request from a good friend. <StartAction>[Sigh.]</Start>
I see. Heh. Think of it as a business proposition, then.
The Aoists in this camp make a fine, fine wine... most wonderful thing you'll ever taste outside of the elven vineyards. I'm not joking, either: I had a taste the last time through here.
The thing is that they keep their wine for "religious purposes" only. Bloody selfish bastards! They won't let me back in the camp now, even.
I've been out of, umm, good spirits since the oasis. You've got a way with getting what you want, <FirstName>, so I was sort of hoping, ummm...
Exactly.
Now that's what I wanted to hear! Woo-hoo!
Have fun!
Heh. Not much anymore, t' tell the truth. But you're welcome to browse the merchandise.
And once you get the wine, you can decide for yourself whether or not we have poisoned it. Heh.
Oh, goody. Take all the thrill out of it for me, why don't ya?
Oh, good grief, <FirstName>. Are you joking? Don't we have better things to do?
<StartAction>[Sigh.]</Start> Well, fine. Off you go, then. Don't worry about little ol' me. I'll get by... somehow...
Let's just say I might be able to come up with a little parting gift that would be worth your while. How's that grab ya?
Well, last time I swiped it off their sacred table in the temple. They might be watching out for that, though, I dunno.
You could always try talking to the priest. Heck, maybe they've repealed that law. Or superstition. Or whatever.
Whoa! Here I am talking to you like you're my friend and you come and hit me with that? What kind of friend are you?
That's more like it, then. So... how about it?
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Pffft. If you're concerned about me, you'll help me out. Believe me... you have *got* to try this wine. Then you'll know why I ask. So how about it?
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Awwww, geeez. Are you serious about all this?
Alright. Okay. I get the picture. Torias is a drunken lout, is he? Well, I can change... no more drinking for me. How about that?
Yeah, well... hmph. Being sober really stinks. There's sand in my pants and it itches.
Now, then... do I get a reward? How about a kiss, hmmm?
Oh, never mind. You'll just break my heart, anyway. You adventuring types are all the same. <StartAction>[Sigh.]</Start>
Believe me, cousin, you were more of a charmer when you were drunk.
Fine, fine. Make me fall off the wagon again, why don't you?
And again! Oh, the humanity! With all this abuse I'm taking, I think I deserve a drink. Don't you?
And you want us to what? Make reservations at the nearest Aoist tavern for you?
Yes, how selfish of them to expect their beliefs be upheld within their own camp. Hmph.
They gots wine? Deekin never tries wine before. Does it makes you happy?
*Very* happy.
Well that not sounds so bad, then.
Well, here's the thing... it's nothing illegal or anything like that. Nothing that would cause you any real trouble, per se...
Ah, that's a sad, sad thing, indeed. You were a great fellow to have along on what is usually a dreary caravan trip. <StartAction>[Sigh.]</Start>
Ah, that's a sad, sad thing, indeed. You were a great lass to have along on such a dreary trip. The legs, the eyes, the spirit... I'll miss 'em all. <StartAction>[Sigh.]</Start>
Oh, you say that now... but the next time I come through this area I bet you'll be some great adventurer who won't even notice a little fellow like me.
Oh, it's nothing... just that I'll miss you, is all. You were a fine, fine companion to lighten up such a dreary trip, you know.
Have you changed your mind, maybe? I can still taste that wine... like a piece o' heaven, it was...
Alright, alright. Something else you needed?
Missed me that much, eh? Don't suppose you got your mittens on a certain bottle...?
What?! But you already said...! You got me all excited and everything!
Well I'll be a wee skinned kitty! So you do! Gimme that!
Mmmm... hrrmmm... gulp!
Yup, that's the stuff. Mighty kind of you. Seeing as you got me such a nice parting gift and all, here's somethin' for you. Hope ya like it.
As for me... I've got some catching up to do. Have fun!

<StartAction>[Hic!]</Start> Guess what I found, <FirstName>! That's right I wound some fine! I mean... I found some wine! Aoish... ummm, Aovian... Ao wine! Wait... <StartAction>[Hic!]</Start> ...didn't you get it for me?
Heh... you want to hear a secret? <StartAction>[Hic!]</Start>
<StartAction>[Hic!]</Start> I drink too much!
Yup. Still sober, here. Dum-de-dum-de-dum...
Something you wanted, <FirstName>?
I swear he's going to explode.
Shush, cousin. Something you wanted, <FirstName>?
Not soon enough, in my opinion.
A good friend? Who are you kidding?
Spit it out.
That I would get you some of this wine?
I'll see what I can do.
I should go.
I'd like to see what you have for sale.
Forget it. I have better things to do than "hooking you up".
<StartAction>[Sigh.]</Start> Fine, fine. I'll look into it.
What's in it for me if I get this wine for you?
And just how would I get you this wine?
Maybe it's time you slowed down on the drinking, Torias.
Fine, fine. Drink away... what do I care?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> I'm concerned about you, Torias, that's all.
No, not really.
Yes, I am.
Congratulations.
I'll believe it when I see it.
Sounds great.
What makes you think we're friends?
Of course, I'll do whatever I can.
What do you want, Torias?
Out with it.
I guess I will, at that.
We might meet each other again.
What's the problem?
I said no and I meant it.
Not really.
No, not yet.
No, and I don't intend on looking, either.
I have a bottle right here, in fact.
Sure. Hit me.
Please do not cause trouble here, my <lord/lady>. This is a place of solemn worship.
Take rest and be welcome here, my <lord/lady>. This is a place of peace.
I greet you most warmly in the name of Ao, the Over-Father, my <lord/lady>.
We always welcome any who would join with us in open debate and contemplation, my <lord/lady>.
You must think us strange to have come to such a desolate place willingly. What better place, however, to contemplate Ao's wisdom without distraction?
I understand there is a temple to Ao in the great city of Waterdeep. They must be very brave to contemplate Him there while surrounded by so much scorn.
It is said that Lord Ao is the over-power even over other gods... but what does that mean? Is he the Creator of all things?
So many others think we are fools for worshipping a god that does not want us. Let them think what they wish... it was Lord Ao who turned out all gods in the Time of Troubles. He is Lord above all.
A group of our young men went to the Valley of Winds to see what happened to the men digging there. They have not returned and we are very worried.
If you have questions about the faith of our Lord Ao, my <lord/lady>, perhaps you might speak to the minister in the temple.
I do not know why the minister does not ask Musharak to leave. We are here to contemplate Ao, not... trade goods and such.
I have a terrible feeling that there is a great evil loose in this land. I pray that Ao will protect us!
I understand one of the wizards who attends the dig in the Valley of Winds returned here last night, wounded terribly. Have you come to see him?
You speak most eloquently, my lord. Are you a man of power and significance where you hail from?
I... am unaccustomed to speaking with men so... charming as yourself, my lord. Please allow me to return to my contemplations.
It is a pleasure to have such a handsome man as yourself visit our humble compound, my lord.
Might you consider joining in our contemplation of Ao? We could use a <man/woman> of your charm and eloquence amongst us.
You are a most beautiful woman, my lady. It is a pleasure to have you visit our compound.
The fact that your god grants you power whereas Ao does not is not proof that Ao should not be worshipped.
We have had a few people like you leave their faith to join in the contemplation of Ao. Is that why you are here, as well?
I hope you have not come here to preach to us about the truth of your god, my <lord/lady>. Ao is very real to us, I assure you.
You don't intend to hurt anyone with that, I hope. We are a peaceful folk, here.
There is no need to walk about our encampment armed. No-one here will hurt you.
Please put your weapon away, my <lord/lady>. This is a peaceful place of worship.
The minister has no spells to heal those wounds you have, but someone in the temple can help bandage you, my <lord/lady>.
How did you receive those wounds? Are you in need of assistance, my <lord/lady>?
You poor soul! You are wounded. Perhaps Valana could help you in the temple.
Me works for Musharak. He smart hobgoblin, trade all over desert.
You move on, or you goes back to caravan. I not cares.
You not talks to me. Talks to Musharak... he gots water, he gots everything you wants.
This be place to trade. Me here just to guard.
Hmph. You here to worship god-that-not-exist, too? Haw! Haw!
You looks like you gots thieving hands. You keep hands off of merchant goods.
You gots business, you talks to Musharak. Musharak is merchant, not I.
Greetings, traveler. You have the look of one who has journeyed a long ways, yet still has far to go.
As you will. May peace walk with you, traveler.
I will help you however I can.
So he does. He is a greedy creature, even for a merchant. Whether or not the wine is sold anywhere, however, is the minister's decision and not mine.
That would be best.
<StartCheck>[Failure-Impossible]</Start> I would defend these people with my life, if need be, but that would gain neither you nor Musharak the wine you wish.
The people here are important to me, and the wine I create is sacred to them. If it is so important to you to sell it, I suggest you speak to the minister.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> I... no. No, there is nothing to be negotiated over with me. As I said, speak to the minister regarding the wine, if anyone.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Perhaps... though I doubt this will lead to anything, to tell the truth.
Musharak is a wealthy creature, with access to many goods and medicines that the Bedine could use. Unfortunately, he charges more for these things than is reasonable.
My people provide him with much and get little in return. If you were to persuade him to change his policy, then... then perhaps I might give him a small but regular supply to sell.
You do that, though I doubt you will get far. Musharak enjoys great wealth from the labors of my people, and he values wealth above all else.
I do not know. I have never been able to convince him before now. If he values this wine as much as he seems to, perhaps that will be enough.
No doubt they would say the wine is mine to do with as I wish. Say anything to the Aoists, however, and whatever deal you arrange is off. Is that clear?
That is true. I do not grow it for myself, however... I grow it for the Aoists to whom I owe a debt. The wine is theirs to do with as they wish.
So you said before. Unless Musharak agrees to give the Bedine the supplies they need, I am not interested in hearing what he wants.
My people knew about the Valley of Winds long before the worshippers of Ao came here. Our tales say that this is a place of death.
When the worshippers came, we avoided them at first, certain that they would stir up the old evils that exist here. They are not explorers, however... they were content simply to live.

So we accepted the Aoists. Our tales eventually reached the ears of wizards in the far lands, however. They came here to explore and dig... perhaps already they have found something they did not wish to.
One of them returned here from the valley, alone and wounded. Others have been sent to to the valley to see what has happened, but they have not returned at all.
That leads me to believe that something has happened at the wizards' site, though I can only pray it does not endanger others here.
There is a passage through the mountain by the waterfall behind the temple. This will lead you into the region we call the Valley of the Winds.
If you seek the site specifically where the wizards are digging, however, you will need to speak to the wounded man at the temple... if you have not already. I have never been there, myself.
Ummm... why they calls it that? Deekin would think it be place of winds. Why not calls it Valley of Death?
I do not know. I suppose my ancestors were not as wise as you, little one.
Now you just makes fun of Deekin. He draws funny caricature of you in epic story, just you wait.
Yes, yes. Are there very many ancient places that your people don't consider places of death?
Some. Why do you ask?
Xanos was beginning to see a pattern. Go on.
Why do they call it the Valley of Winds? Any particular reason?
Because it is very windy amidst the chasms.
Now don't I feel like the smartest dwarf around? <StartAction>[Sigh.]</Start> Go on.
Yes. It is no great orchard as I'm sure exists in more fertile lands. Indeed, if I did not coax this gentle life from the sands, it would not even grow here.
It is an old tradition amongst the druids of my people... the wine is sacred and used in meditations and rare rituals. The Aoists have adopted this custom and I am glad to provide it for them.
I'm afraid that's impossible. You'd need to speak to the minister in the temple, but I'm sure he will refuse.
Speak to Musharak. Now that he sells the sacred wine, it should not be so difficult for you to acquire.
Repaying a debt. When I was a young child, I still lived with my fellow Bedine. I became lost in the desert one day, and the Aoists found me near death.
They nursed me back to health, and so I have stayed here to perform this one task for them. They revere the desert wine, so I am glad to make it.
My name is Jasmeena. This is my grove, simple as it may seem. I tend it with affection, regardless, and the wine made from the fruit of these plants is well-loved by the worshippers, here.
I am. The province of a druid is not solely that of verdant hills and forests. Nature exists here in the desert, as well, and its caretaking requires the same caution.
I am... as are you, I see. It is good to meet a <brother/sister> of nature, even if you are from a far different land than I.
Not true. Not everyone who comes to this camp is simply passing through. Neither are you, I suspect. You are here for a very specific reason, though I know not what.

It is for some. You will note that the worshippers of Ao came to this one place specifically and intend to go no further. This is also a place the Bedine would happily inhabit, were it not already taken.
It is doubtful that you are here to worship, and you are certainly not one of my own people. I was speaking metaphorically, however.
I saw you arrive with the caravan. The fact that the wizard returned from the Valley of Winds also today hardly seems a coincidence.
One of the wizards who seeks to uncover the ancient ruins of Netheril that are so plentiful in the valley. I hear he came here this morning, gravely injured.
That such a thing has happened does not surprise me at all. Those ruins contain power that is best forgotten. If you're curious, however, you might seek the man out in the temple.
You return, traveler. Is there something else you need from me?
Indeed? Very well, then. I am not proud of what I must do, but if it will help my people then a small supply to make Musharak happy will not hurt.
I will watch him, however. Should he try to cheat my people once more, then he gets nothing at all. I am sure that will be incentive enough.
Thank you, traveler. Though you no doubt arranged this deal for whatever reward Musharak has offered you, you have also done my people a service. I wish you well.
I should go.
I would like to ask you some questions.
Musharak wants to sell this wine of yours.
Perhaps I'll talk to the minister, then.
<StartCheck>[Intimidate]</Start> If you don't want to see these Aoists hurt, you'll do as Musharak wishes.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Is there nothing that could change your mind?
I'll talk to Musharak, then.
And how am I supposed to convince Musharak to do such a thing?
And what would the Aoists think of such an arrangement, I wonder?
But you're the one who grows the wine.
Tell me about this Valley of Winds.
Why do you say that?
How do I reach this valley?
So this is where the famous Aoist wine is grown?
Is there any way I could get some of this wine?
What is a Bedine doing here amongst these worshippers?
Who are you?
So you're a druid?
I bet you say that to everyone.
That's not hard to figure out. This place is hardly a destination.
How do you know anything about me?
What wizard is this?
Musharak has agreed to supply the Bedine... in exchange for wine.
The leopard looks at you with intelligent eyes. The fact that it hisses and pulls its ears back flat tells you it does not care for what it sees.
The leopard swishes its tail agitatedly and watches you with wary eyes, obviously not caring for your presence.
The leopard regards you with mild curiosity and does not shy away from you. After a moment it pretends you don't exist.
This handsome leopard is Jasmeena's animal companion. He regards you with intelligent, wary eyes and sends an empathetic greeting.
He acknowledges your departure and returns his attention to guarding his mistress.

The leopard has little to say that is of use... other than the fact that there is an ill wind coming from the great valleys beyond the mountain. It carries with it the scent of death and unnatural beasts.

A human male crawled into the camp this morning who stank of that place. The leopard cannot be more specific as to the nature of the beasts, but has been on guard constantly since he first smelled them.

The leopard responds to your empathic communication with images from his mind. He explains that his mistress is a druid of the desert realms, and that while she stays in this camp she is not like the other humans here.

He has little else to add other than his great affection for her. He warns you not to commit any violence against her or the people of the camp. His mistress commands powerful magic which she will use to defend them.
You fish into your pack for a few strips of dried meat. The leopard sniffs at them but declines. It prefers live prey.
<StartAction>Bid the leopard farewell.</Start>
<StartAction>Ask the leopard for any useful information it might have.</Start>
<StartAction>Ask the leopard for information about his mistress.</Start>
<StartAction>Give the leopard a snack.</Start>
Excuse me, but I'm trying to meditate. Please speak to the high priest if you have any questions.
The Messiah speaks to me. Oh, Holy Ao, heal the wounds I caused myself in your name, and I will give you a worthy gift.
Holy Ao, I live to serve.
I will give you my gift. Here it is, Holy Ao.
I pray for the time when you will grant me powers of my own, that I might go out and spread word that you are the supreme being.
Thank you so much, Holy Ao.
<StartCheck>[Successful]</Start> I will give you my gift. Here it is, Holy Ao. Please do not smite me! I live only to serve you.
I am sorry, Holy Ao. I will give you my gift. Please do not smite me! I live only to serve you.
Holy Ao, you have my gift. Please grant me mighty powers to show the world that you are the supreme being.
You cannot be Holy Ao! He would not come down here just to ignore us!
A common thug. What a wasted life.
Goodbye.
<StartHighlight>[Cast Charm]</Start> You will give me your gift.
<StartHighlight>[Cast a healing spell.]</Start>
<StartHighlight>[Use a healing potion.]</Start> This should make it all better. It contains some of my holy blood.
<StartHighlight>[Use a healing kit.]</Start> This should make it all better. My holy powers are bound into these bandages.
<StartCheck>[Persuade - Intimidate]</Start> Give me your gift or I shall smite you with my holy wrath.
I am not Ao! And you should not wound yourself anymore.
Excuse me, but I'm trying to meditate. Please speak to the high priest if you have any questions.
The Messiah speaks to me. Oh, great <Lord/Lady>, show me a wonderous sign and I will give you a worthy gift.
Great <Lord/Lady>, I live to serve.
I will give you my gift. Here it is, Great <Lord/Lady>.
I pray for the time when you will grant me powers of my own, that I might go out and spread word of your dominion.
That was amazing, Great <Lord/Lady>!
<StartCheck>[Successful]</Start> I will give you my gift. Here it is, Great <Lord/Lady>. Please do not smite me! I live only to serve you.
I am sorry, Great <Lord/Lady>. I will give you my gift. Here it is, Great <Lord/Lady>. Please do not smite me! I live only to serve you.
Great <Lord/Lady>, I have given you my gift. I await the moment when you grant me mighty powers to show the world your dominion.
You cannot be Holy Ao! He would not come down here just to ignore us!
Get out of my sight. Your kind sicken me.
Goodbye.
<StartHighlight>[Cast Charm]</Start> You will give me your gift.
<StartHighlight>[Cast a spectacular divine spell.]</Start>
<StartHighlight>[Cast a spectacular arcane spell.]</Start>
<StartCheck>[Persuade - Intimidate]</Start> Give me your gift or I shall smite you with my holy wrath.
I am not Ao!
Excuse me, but I'm trying to study the ways of apathy. Please speak to the high priest if you have any questions.
The Messiah speaks to me. Oh, Mighty God Incarnate, show these fools your divine apathy and ignore their pleas for help.
Do not listen to him, Holy Ao. Come and hear my plea and I will give you my gift.
And hear my plea, Great <Lord/Lady>, and you will also have mine.
The true Ao would not be swayed so easily.
Mighty God Incarnate, I live to serve.
You show your true colors. Leave me be, that I can search for the divine essence of apathy.
Then it is yours. Go into the world and show just how little you care.
Do as you wish, I do not care.
That should not matter to a powerful being like Ao.
Mighty God Incarnate, you have my gift. I worship you as the true spirit of godly apathy.
You cannot be the true incarnation of Ao, or you would have ignored the other fools and their pleas. Leave me be, that I can search for the divine essence of apathy.
I really don't care that you threatened our lives. That doesn't mean I want to be your friend, however.
Goodbye.
Two gifts is better than one. Goodbye.
Since you show true understanding of my apathy, I will take your gift.
I will listen to them first.
What is your gift?
I see you are back, good <lord/lady>. How may I help you?
Right you are, m'<lord/lady>. Have a good day then.
Ah, another outsider, and I see you come with the caravan. It is good to see you. We don't get many visitors, and now two in one day.
Oh, this morning, just at sunrise, a half-dead man came crawling in here looking for a healer. I took him to the main temple so they could tend to his wounds.
I haven't seen him since, but no one said he died either, so I guess that is where you would find him, if you're interested.
It shouldn't be too hard. He should be in the temple.
Oh, you've heard about that, have you? I'm not surprised. The Aoists keep their special wine solely for sacred rituals, but word seems to have leaked out about it anyway.
If you're thinking of getting some, you can forget it. The minister is pretty strict about that... and I really doubt Jasmeena would go against his orders.
Nothing that I know of. Why don't you ask him?
Some kind of berry that Jasmeena grows... right out of the sand, if you can believe it. I don't know what they're called, though.
Ho ho! Oh, yes. I managed to swipe a tumbler off the temple's wine table several months ago. It was like a taste of heaven... I can't even describe it.
She's a Bedine... you'll find her next to the berry field. Jasmeena is the one who makes the wine for the minister.
She isn't an Aoist, however. Why she agrees to grow the berries and make the wine when there's no money in it for her is beyond me.
There is little to tell. I'm not really much of a believer, I'm afraid. It seems like even if this Ao does exist, he couldn't care less about anyone worshipping him.
So his followers gather and contemplate the "nature of apathy" and so forth. Lots of debate, peaceful contemplation... that sort of thing. At least things are quiet.
I came here because my master, a former follower of Waukeen, came out here. He was searching for a new faith and found it in the Ao.
Once my master found his new calling, he freed me. I didn't have anywhere better to be, so I decided to stay here and work as a guard. It's hot, thirsty work, but it could be worse.
Well, it's a desert, m'<lord/lady>, hot with lots of sand and sun, but not much water.

Oh, I see, I suppose you meant tell you about the encampment. Well now, not much more to tell you. The Aoists built a temple, where the minister meets with the faithful to contemplate... or whatever they call it.
Otherwise, we've got a good spring to supply us with water. And we serve as a trading post for the Bedine and the occasional caravan... so it's not too bad, overall, if you don't mind the scorpions.
I think he's one of the wizards that digs around amongst the ruins in the Valley of Winds. Err... Garrick something.
Sure thing.
Right. If you want to see the injured man, he should be in the temple. Good luck to you.
Well... if you go into the encampment, you'll see some carvings on the cliff face north of the temple. They were here when the Aoists first got here, I'm told.
Anyhow, there's a doorway by the waterfall that leads into a tunnel that goes right through the mountain. After that, you're in the Valley of the Winds.
I think that's what the Bedine call the place. It's supposed to be full of ruins and the like... that's what attracted the wizards here in the first place.
I imagine they're looking for relics. Couldn't really say more than that, though.
I think there's about a dozen of them. They come here to buy supplies from Musharak evey once in a while, but that's all we see of them, to be honest.
Oh. He's a trader from one of the desert tribes, runs the market here. Umm... he's a hobgoblin, so don't get too surprised when you see him or anything. He's not so bad.
That's the one. He's the head of the fellows out there... what do they call themselves? Archaeologists? Anyway, something bad must have happened.
A little. We sent some of our boys out to take a look, see if the wizards need help. They haven't come back yet, however.
Why he wants healer? A dragon tries to eats him, maybe?
I dunno. He wasn't really all that talkative, but from the looks of him you might very well be right.
I should go.
You mentioned an injured man earlier?
Where is this other visitor?
What are you babbling about?
Two? Who else is here?
I guess I will go find him then.
What do you know about the wine made here?
Nothing would change the minister's mind?
What's it made out of?
Is it really as good as they say?
Who is this Jasmeena?
Tell me about this god, Ao.
Why are you out here in the desert?
Tell me about this place.
Do you know anything about this injured man?
I'd like to ask something else.
I should go.
What is this Valley of the Winds?
Do you know what these wizards are looking for?
Are there many of these wizards?
This wizard you mentioned... would he be Garrick Halassar?
Who is Musharak?
Would it be Garrick Halassar?
Doesn't that worry you?

Hello? Do I know... ahhh! Mmm... sorry. Sometimes I get these stabbing pains in my side. The high priest was able to patch my wounds, but they have no actual healing skills. <StartAction>[Cough]</Start>
I... oh... gods... the pain is getting worse. I hate to ask, but is there anything you have or can do to help me?
Please, take the last few gold... <StartAction>[Cough, choke, cough.]</Start> They say you came with a caravan... oh, argh, find me something. I think I am dying.
Ah, that feels a bit better. Thank you so much. Now, I am Garrick, who are you?
I am very pleased that you were able to find me then, <FirstName>. I am unsure of what help I can be to you, but I owe you, so anything you need is absolutely free.
Our excavation was attacked. They killed all of my fellow archeologists and the workers. It was horrible! They attacked just before dawn and... no, I... cannot speak of it.
I keep seeing Jessep getting torn in half, right in front of my eyes. Please, I cannot bear to relive that moment. I need a distraction, something... anything to keep my mind occupied.
A mythallar! Where did you get that? No, that is not important right now. You can tell me all about it later. I... I wonder if your presence and the attack on my excavation might be linked.
Yes, she must have been able to sense the crystal in the general area and thought we had it. That is the only thing that makes sense.
Oh, you must think I have lost my mind. I'm sorry. I had better organize my thoughts for a second, do you mind?
Alright, I think I have bits and fragments of knowledge that I will try to piece together to make this all have some sense to it.
What you have is a powerful artifact from the time of the ancient civilization of Netheril. This is what I have been studying out here; ruins of their civilization.
I wish I could tell you exactly what the mythallar was used for, but no one is really sure. I do know that when a mythallar was damaged, it could cause great destruction.
I have found several ancient writings that describe the mythallar, referring to them in the use of arcane spells and powerful magical items.
One told of a mage who walked into an enemy's home and smashed a mythallar on the stone floor, destroying everything within several miles. Apparently they are quite fragile.
About a month ago my researchers uncovered a portal room in the ruins. I believe that this portal was used by the Netheril to teleport between their cities.
I had not activated the portal yet, but I think I was fairly close. Where it would lead? I have no idea, but this morning I got a clue.
A strange figure, wearing a dark cloak, appeared in the portal room just before dawn with an army of demonic creatures. The horrific monsters tore through my friends with a savage haste.
One of them grabbed me and nearly tore out my intestines. I was thrown against a pillar and left for dead, but somehow I managed to regain consciousness.
She, and I do believe it was a she... from her voice, her face was hidden... came in from above through a tunnel. She was trying to use the portal, but I do not think she was successful yet.
She spoke of going to a place with limitless power, but she was angry. She said she had expected to find a mythallar here, and could not afford to have it remain out of her hands.
After the demonic horde searched our corpses, and I gave the most convincing acting job of my life playing dead, she cursed and said she would wait no longer. She would take her chances.
She told her army to hunt for a small, round crystal; that she could feel it was within miles of the ruins. Then she turned her attention to activating the portal.

The creatures left, and while her attention was drawn I crawled quietly away and very slowly made my way back here. I thought I would stop at our home camp, but her army had already killed everyone there.

They must have returned to the ruins though, because I could hear them as I left, fighting something. I found one of our camels, wounded but alive, and rode it here. The beast died just outside of town.

Ah. If you look to the north of this temple, you will see an entrance by the waterfall. Go through it and find your way to the Valley of Winds. We marked it well, so it should not be too difficult to find.
Me? Keep it here? But this place is all but defenseless! And there may be another need for this device.
Yes, I see you are thinking along the same lines as I am.
This is what I think. You need to go to this woman and stop her from going through the portal... if she has not already done so. If she has, you must follow her through.
There is no telling what is on the other side of that device. I think she expects to find Netherese artifacts of almost limitless power, untouched after all these ages. And if she does, what then?
She may be seeking this mythallar for her own uses, or perhaps she fears it. With all the power at her disposal, using the mythallar you possess as a weapon might be the only way to defeat her.
You must do it, but I have an idea that might be of some help.
I would be of little use to you there, but I can do something that might help.
I have a spell that will take me some time to set up, but if I can get it to work, I can reach Drogan with it. It is possible that he might be able to send help, or even to come himself.
I know him well enough to say that when it is this important, he will think of something to help. There are a lot of preparations I must make, so unless you have questions, I should get started.
Good luck, <FirstName>. When you reach her... hurt her. Hurt her bad. The men and women she killed today, they were good people. Make her feel their pain.

There is an entrance by the waterfall just north of this temple. Go through it and find your way to the Valley of Winds. The dig site is there... we marked it well, so it should not be too hard to find.
Are you kidding? Right now your enemy has only had a short headstart. If you wait for me to cast this spell, you might be giving her enough time to be ready to defeat you.
She is in unfamiliar territory, ripe for an ambush, and she doesn't have her army with her. You need to go quickly and go now.
Ask them quickly. Time is precious.
You had better be off then. I should get started on that spell.
This hardly seems to be the appropriate time to be reliving old acquaintances, but I guess you have a right to know. Drogan once saved me from a labyrinth.
I was doing some research on the Netherese, (yes, I know I have an unhealthy fascination with them) and found a small puzzle box.
It seemed to be just an interesting toy, but when I played with it, I was sucked inside an elaborate maze, where I wandered for several months, until I was found and released by Drogan.
The Netheril were so powerful that even their toys could capture the mind and hold it captive.
No, just the opposite. Don't you see? The Netheril were so powerful that even their toys could capture the mind and hold it captive.
It really was. The Netherese were so powerful that even their toys could capture the mind and hold it captive.
Imagine a society so rich and powerful that they can waste time and money on elaborate entertainments that last days, even months before the fascination wears off.
It must have been an exciting place to live. But anyways, Drogan is an old hand at solving puzzles and dealing with magic. Once he rescued me, we became friends. And that is all there is to tell.
I truly do not know. There were pillars in the area which had buttons. These might have activated it... I was too cautious to experiment, to tell the truth.
With luck, the woman will not know how to activate it, either. Anything else?
Once you get in the ruins, you will have to find your way down. The portal room was the last place we reached, so you should be able to find it, if you just keep moving.
That is probably a good idea anyways, since the ruins may still be crawling with those demonic creatures. Anything else?

Ah. If you look to the north of this temple, you will see an entrance by the waterfall. Go through it and find your way to the Valley of Winds. We marked it well, so it should not be too difficult to find.
Think of all that treasure just... sitting there, waiting for someone to help themselves to it!
Power! Power such as has not been seen on Faerun for a millenia. This could be... a good time for us, or a very bad time.
Oooo! Deekin think epic tale of boss just get much more epic!
It is a wonder that Deekin didn't break it and destroy us all. Thank Vergadain for small favors.
And that stupid kobold had this in his keeping? I am surprised we are not dead already!
Ummm... suddenly Deekin feel sick... he play catch with crystal for hours back in hills...
Apparently this one has not recovered mentally from his injuries. We might have to let him rest a while longer.
You are babbling like a sunbaked fool! Make some sense or go back to your fevered sleep.
Is just little crystal. Deekin thinking old man be out in sun too long.
A pupil of Drogan's would slaughter these innocent lives? Times must be harder than I thought. You had better have a good reason for your actions; I am sure Drogan would be disgusted.
I am Garrick. <StartHighlight>[Cough, cough, hack, cough.]</Start> I am an archaeologist. Argh... please help me.
<StartHighlight>[Cough, cough, gasp.]</Start> Have you got... it?
Ah, that feels a bit better. Thank you so much. Now, I am Garrick, who are you?
Now, I need two pinches... or was that three bites... no, no, it was... oh, hello, <FirstName>. How can I assist you now?
Goodbye.
I have little time for questions, if I am to complete this spell, so be quick.
You had better be off then. I must complete my spell as soon as possible.
This hardly seems to be the appropriate time to be reliving old acquaintances, but I guess you have a right to know. Drogan once saved me from a labyrinth.
I was doing some research on the Netherese, (yes, I know I have an unhealthy fascination with them) and found a small puzzle box.
It seemed to be just an interesting toy, but when I played with it, I was sucked inside an elaborate maze, where I wandered for several months, until I was found and released by Drogan.
The Netheril were so powerful that even their toys could capture the mind and hold it captive.
No, just the opposite. Don't you see? The Netheril were so powerful that even their toys could capture the mind and hold it captive.
It really was. The Netherese were so powerful that even their toys could capture the mind and hold it captive.
Imagine a society so rich and powerful that they can waste time and money on elaborate entertainments that last days, even months before the fascination wears off.
It must have been an exciting place to live. But anyways, Drogan is an old hand at solving puzzles and dealing with magic. Once he rescued me, we became friends. And that is all there is to tell.
I truly do not know. There were pillars in the area which had buttons. These might have activated it... I was too cautious to experiment, to tell the truth.
With luck, the woman will not know how to activate it, either. Anything else?
Once you get in the ruins, you will have to find your way down. The portal room was the last place we reached, so you should be able to find it, if you just keep moving.
That is probably a good idea anyways, since the ruins may still be crawling with those demonic creatures. Anything else?
There is an entrance in the cliff face north of the temple... go through it and make your way to the Valley of Winds. We marked it well, so it shouldn't be too difficult to find. Anything else?
I am still getting ready. I warned you that this could take a while.
Take the mythallar, go to the excavation site and find the portal room in the ruins. Stop the hooded woman from going through... and if she has already gone, you must follow her.
Try to find out how to use the mythallar to defeat this demoness. It is a tall order, but I am sure you can do it. I will keep trying to reach Drogan for help.
I hope Drogan found you. *Whew* I am exhausted! Good luck with everything.
I am sorry, I have nothing to heal you with.
I can help. <StartHighlight>[Lay hands on him.]</Start>
I can heal you. <StartHighlight>[Cast a healing spell on him.]</Start>
Here, drink this. <StartHighlight>[Use a healing potion on him.]</Start>
Here, let me try this. <StartAction>[Use a healing kit.]</Start>
Drogan never said you would be this hard to find. I'm <FirstName>.
My name is <FullName>. Drogan sent me to get your help.
I am <FirstName>. My teacher, Drogan, sent me to find you.
You better tell me what you are doing here first.
What is this? <StartHighlight>[Show him the crystal.]</Start>
What happened to you? Why were you so hurt?
I need you to tell me about this crystal.
What ever, just hurry up.
If it means you might start making sense, then do it.
Please do.
No, go ahead.
What else do you know about it?
How do you damage one?
How do you know this?
Hurry up and get to the part where this makes sense.
Go on.
I think I have seen this cloaked figure before. But go on.
Did you get to see the cloaked figure's face?
Did the cloaked figure come through the portal?
So she is gone, but the portal remains?
So she went through the portal?
Where is the excavation?
You keep the mythallar, while I go hunt this cloaked figure.
You said the mythallar could be used as a weapon?
I guess I need to get this mythallar away from here.
What would you suggest I do?
I won't do it.
I suppose there is little choice.
I can't face her alone.
Will you come with me?
I guess I should get going.
I want to speak with Master Drogan.
Why don't I just wait and speak to Drogan.
I have some questions.
That's all my questions.
How do you know Drogan?
Go on.
Boring.
Interesting.
How do I activate the portal?
Where is the portal room?
Where is the excavation?
Who are you?
Goodbye.
I have some questions.
That's all my questions.
How do you know Drogan?
Go on.
Boring.
Interesting.
How do I activate the portal?
Where is the portal room?
Where is the excavation?
How goes the spell?
Could you summarize what I am supposed to do?
I want you to tell me everything again.
Welcome to the humble abode of we few followers of Lord Ao, my <lord/lady>.
You are welcome in the house of Ao, as are all who seek answers.
I will answer whatever you want to know about Ao, but not personal questions.
May the wisdom of Ao keep you safe on your journeys.
Err... yes, but that was not our initial intention. After we built this temple, word of our presence spread and some trading caravans started to stop here on their way across the desert.
We offered them water in exchange for supplies. It was not until Musharak showed up that the trading became more prevalent. But that is his business, and not ours.
I admit, I never would have thought of a hobgoblin as a trader... but that really seems to be all Musharak is interested in.
According to the Bedine, he spent years trading amongst their tribes until he settled here. Now he trades with both the Bedine as well as the caravans that come through here.
It has meant we can no longer trade water for equipment, of course, but I suppose that is how it was meant to be.
Of course.
Yes, yes, he keeps demanding that "honor". I have told Musharak repeatedly, however, that it's quite impossible. The wine is only given to worshippers of Ao.
We would only even *think* of providing wine to Musharak to be sold if he was either a worshipper of Ao like the rest of us or if, perhaps, he considered sharing his profits with the temple.
And since Musharak is unlikely to agree to either of those things, I am pretty sure you are wasting your time, my <lord/lady>.
Now, if you will excuse me, I must return to my meditations.
Share his profits? Ha, ha, ha... eh... well what kind of reaction do you expect from the hobgoblin?
It occurs to Xanos that changing a merchant's views about profits are as unlikely as changing a priest's religion. Neither option seems likely to happen.
"And the great hero set forth on his quest to convert the heathen infidels!" Deekin thinks that has good ring to it.
<StartCheck>[Failure-Impossible]</Start> Perhaps we could, but it is certainly no simple manner of saying please and thank you, my <lord/lady>.
<StartCheck>[Failure-Impossible]</Start> Hmph. You can threaten us all if that makes you happy, but that will not get Musharak his wine.
He has? You're joking.
Well, I'll believe it when I see his idol, and not a moment sooner. Musharak would lie about anything to sell our wine, I'm sure.
He gave you his sacred idol? Let me see that. Then... then he must be serious, after all. Amazing!
Very well, then. I'll go and talk to him and... and we'll see about arranging some wine to be sold. If he's one of the faithful, then it should be alright.
He has? By Ao's grace, I can only imagine what it took to convince him of that. I suppose he wants to sell our wine in exchange, now?
So you somehow convinced Musharak that he owed us, did you? Remarkable. And this agreement of his comes with no strings?
Ahhh, perhaps it is time we spoke to him seriously about the wine. It... it would do us good to have a small income, perhaps. The temple needs fixing, and we could hire more guards...
Yes, I... I suppose it would do us some good to have some kind of income. We can fix up the temple and perhaps even hire a few more guards...
Thank you, my <lord/lady>. You've been most kind in arranging this for us. I wouldn't have thought it possible.
So you said before. And as I said, that's not going to happen unless Musharak converts or shares his profits with us... which likely means never.
Our wine is very important to us, my <lord/lady>. It is not just "business", as Musharak would like to think.
He is not an Aoist, and scoffs openly at our beliefs. If he stays with us, I would at least hope for tolerance, if nothing else.
If you wish. Musharak is anything but agreeable when it comes to us, however.
His presence benefits the caravans and the Bedine. It also allows us a place to buy goods, though we've very little coin to do so now that we trade no water.
I cannot contemplate the nature of apathy if I do not practice it... no matter how difficult that might be.
Well... because Musharak trades it. There is no reason for us to do any trading if that is what he does.
No, of course not. He is not an Aoist... he uses our encampment out of convenience.
We have no law, here. All are welcome, whether they worship Ao with us or not. Even Musharak.
I... suppose so. I doubt Musharak would agree, however.
Get rid of him? Oh, no, no... that's not necessary. We welcome all here, whether they choose to worship Ao with us or not. Even Musharak.
I never would have thought we would start selling our wine through him, as well. I can only pray it is for the best.
Still, it does not feel right to deal with such a creature as he. We shall see how it turns out, I suppose.
And now he sells our wine, as well. Ah, yes... of course we know Jasmeena is supplying it to him. I have no objection... it's hers to do with as she desires.
Yes, for a hobgoblin he actually seems quite likeable. I never thought to hear such words coming from my mouth.
Jasmeena is a Bedine, and not a believer in Ao at all. When she was very young, she was bitten by a desert snake... our men found her dying in the desert and brought her back here.
I nursed her back to health myself, though it was a close thing. She has stayed here ever since... her choice, though she says she owes us a debt.
At any rate, it is Jasmeena who makes our wine for us... part of the rituals we follow. I am certainly glad to have her here, though she's always free to leave.
It's something we've borrowed from Bedine traditions and made our own. In fact, it's really our only truly Aoist tradition... we value it highly.
If you wish. The wizard barely was able to crawl into the encampment this morning his injuries were so severe. We patched him up as best we could, but we have limited resources.
He has never held much with our religion, so he and his other explorers rarely come here. I do not hold it against him, however. We will help any in need.
What would you like to ask?
There is a doorway in the cliff face north of the temple. It leads through the mountains... and on the other side you'll find many chasms, along with the entrance to the Valley of the Winds.
We had no idea of the significance of this place when we settled here, of course. The water was what made it attractive. It was the Bedine who told us about the valley, eventually.
I have never been there, myself. If you wish to know more about it, perhaps you might consider speaking to Jasmeena.
No, none of them. I sent a couple of our men to the Valley of Winds, but they have not returned. It would be a sad day, indeed, if such fine scholars have all met their end.
If the explorers have unleashed something that destroyed them, we can only hope it does not follow Garrick here... for we have little to protect ourselves with.
But if it is meant to be, it is meant to be. Naturally there are dangers out here in the desert. We knew that when we came.
He has not said. His injuries were such that he has been asleep most of the time, and I have not pressed him.
I have little doubt that the explorers found something they did not wish to within the Valley of Winds. There are things yet in the desert that frighten even the Bedine.
I could not even begin to guess. When Garrick and his fellows first arrived here in their search for Netherese ruins, I knew it would eventually come to ill.
I do not say that out of any simple superstition. Wizards ever search for answers in places where sane men would fear to tread.
Xanos wonders where such premonitions come from. These men came to discover information about a powerful empire. Their research could be extremely important.
He did not say while he was wounded. You have healed him, however, have you not? Perhaps Garrick will tell you, himself, what occurred.
I see that you were able to heal him, yourself. Thank you. Though he and his other explorers have never held much with our religion, we certainly don't wish them harm.
You too? Our wine has become so popular that some days it seems as if we are considered a vineyard and not a temple. What is it that you wish, exactly?
As you wish. Is there something else?
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> How dare you walk in here and simply demand that we give you our sacred wine! Well, you'll not get any, I assure you.
I... see. If you'll excuse me, then, I must return to my meditations.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> I see. Very well... take this bottle and get out. You'll get nothing more from us, brute.
You couldn't. The wine that is made here is for our meditational purposes only. We take that quite seriously... nobody outside of the temple may have any.
I'm afraid not. The wine is for Aoists only.
Perhaps so. We Aoists have no history or traditions to follow, however... this is our first. It is ours alone and we value it, highly. I would not want it taken from us by the greedy.
<StartAction>[Failure - Impossible]</Start> I am sure you could. Wealth, however, is not what I am interested in. I left a lifetime of wealth behind, my friend.
Speak to Musharak. Perhaps Jasmeena has already supplied him with some to sell to you. I certainly hope you don't expect *us* to start selling the sacred wine now, as well.
So if there isn't anything else?
Jasmeena makes our wine... her grove is on the south side of the encampment. She will not give you any wine, however, if that's what you're looking for.
My name is unimportant, as are all personal details about the life I once led before I came here. Like the god I follow, I am a strong believer in privacy.
There is so little, yet so much to tell, I hardly know where to begin. Is there anything specific you would like to know?
There is a test of wisdom to see if one has the right state of mind. Then you must only follow your own path to seek the great god. There is no dogma to practice, here.
No, we have had too much trouble with that already. The foolishness must stop somewhere!
If you wish. Taking the test does not make one a follower unless that is your wish. Nothing is forced on anyone by Ao.
Lighter than air, heavier than the mountains, longer than a river, shorter than a breath, without end, yet always finished. What am I?
What magnificent insight! I do believe that is the best answer I have ever heard.
Could it be possible? Could this be the one we have been waiting for?
Yes, yes, it must be <him/her>! This is what we have sought!
I... I suppose it could be. It was a very good answer, after all.
You are the avatar, the incarnation of our god. You are Ao!
Wh-what?! Wait now, what are you talking about? <He/She> is not Ao!
Yes <he/she> is! I can sense <his/her> power now! My Great <Lord/Lady>, thank you for coming to us!
Praise heaven, you have come to us at last! How would you like me to beat myself for your worship, Holy Ao?
I think my flock has lost a few sheep, that's what I think. I can't believe you started this.
Your words have wisdom that stretches beyond the mortal plane! We shall dote on everything you teach us, master.
Yes, tell us more, Great <Lord/Lady>.
Look how he denies his holiness! Just as Ao has always done!
Thank you for revealing yourself to us! Now we can be sure that we were wise and followed the right path!
How shall we get away from you, Holy Ao?
I have a gift for you, Great <Lord/Lady>. Come and speak to me and you shall have my gift.
Me too, Holy Ao! Speak to me!
I don't know about this. You should speak to me first.
Great. Now look what you have done. I need to meditate. Leave me out of this.
<StartHighlight>[He catches it.]</Start> A gift! A gift from Holy Ao! This is a holy pebble!
