Neverwinter Nights stores user-visible text, such as Conversations, Names, and Descriptions, as Localized Strings, or LocStrings.
A LocString can contain several substrings in different languages. Each substring has an ID that tells the game what language the substring is written for.
When a user plays a module, the game will pick the substring that matches the user's own language, if there is such a string. Otherwise, it picks the first string available.
The available languages are:
English French German Italian Spanish Polish Korean Chinese Traditional Chinese Simplified Japanese
This is also the order that the game will search for a string if there is no string in the user's own language.

Beholders are formidable opponents, capable of incapacitating their enemies in a variety of horrible ways.
Beholder mages have sacrificed the use of their eye-stalks in favor of more traditional (but just as deadly) magical spells.
Driders are bloodthirsty creatures that lurk in the depths of the earth, seeking warm-blooded prey of any kind.
Mind flayers, or illithids, are so insidious, diabolical and powerful that all denizens of the dark fear them. Elder mind flayers were once but a whispered threat, an unseen nightmare. Until now.
Mind flayers, or illithids, are so insidious, diabolical and powerful that all denizens of the dark fear them.
These small creatures are close cousins to beholders. They are powerful only in great numbers.
This massive golem towers above most other creatures and is resistant to most physical and magical attacks.
A mithral golem is capable of quick and lethal action, making it one of the most powerful of golems.
Mimics take the form of inanimate objects to catch unwary adventures.
Prismatic dragons are flamboyant, personable and charming. They avoid confrontation, fighting only if attacked.
Shadow dragons prefer to attack from hiding, employing their natural abilities to blend into the shadows.
A staple in the diets of many drow and duergar communities, these herd animals of the Underdark are small but powerfully built.
A more malignant and wretched creature than the harpy is difficult to imagine. Taking great glee in causing suffering and death, the sadistic harpy is always watching for new victims.
Bebiliths are huge, predatory, arachnid demons that hunt other demons. While their favorite prey is tanar'ri they aren't picky -- they will stalk and attack anything.
Azers are dwarves native to the Elemental Plane of Fire.
A death slaad that survives for more than a century retreats into isolation for an entire year, metamorphosing into the dread white slaad.
After a white slaad has survived for a century it transforms into a larger, stronger form of slaad -- the black.
These undead mind flayers are a rising power in the twisted politics of the Underdark.
Demiliches are wiser, older and far deadlier than common liches.
Dracoliches are undead dragons that have taken the path of immortality, gaining tremendous powers and abilities in the process.
Svirfneblin or deep gnomes are reclusive, suspicious and resentful of intrusion.

The ground gives way and you fall into a sinkhole.

The bar appears to have been carved whole out of a black, granite-like material that sparkles and is cool to the touch. Hidden underneath it are numerous shelves full of flasks containing the most exotic wines (referred to as "jhinrae") and other sorts of beverages available in the Underdark. A great many of them appear black and vile... indeed, some may actually be poison for those instances when the barkeep decides that one of his clientele has become more trouble than he's worth... or perhaps is worth more dead than alive. Either way, poison is far from the only thing that kills customers in a drow drinking establishment, so as the saying goes: "Khaless nau uss mzild taga dosstan" ...trust no-one more than yourself.
Several sheets of paper, scattered on the ground.
A heap of paper sheets scattered around on the floor.
A simple, blank sheet of paper ... not the most exciting sight.
This marble bookcase is filled with dusty old tomes.
A drow made dresser ... even the dark elves need a place to store their cloth.
Judging from its style, this elaborate dresser has been crafted from a rare type of marble, usually only found in the depths of the Underdark.
A storage crate, crafted from the black stone usually found in the Underdark.
A sturdy crate, made from the type of black stone that is usually found in the areas of the Underdark that are inhabited by the drow.
A black barrel - made of stone and reinforced with metal bands - a simple and cheap storage solution.
Bound in leather, this tome looks well worn, and the writing on the cover has already started to fade.

"Have you got that 30,000 gold you owe me, fuzz-knuckle? My grinder ain't going to repair itself..."
"Have you got that 50,000 gold you owe me, fuzz-knuckle? My grinder ain't going to repair itself..."
"Pike off! Can't you see I'm busy here? Quarry Grinder 5 just went down. Bloody incompetent filth-puppets! This store is closed until I figure out what in the Nine Hells is going on!"
"What part of 'pike off' don't you understand!? Gibbering buzzards! How many times do I have to tell you that this store is closed until Quarry Grinder 5 is back in operation!"
"I suppose you're expecting a thank you card, aren't you? Coal-black pimple on a glabrezu... Now pike off!"
"You useless sack of lemure-flesh, why do you insist on coming back? Haven't I suffered enough?"
"So you woke the Sleeping Man, did you? Ha! I'm sure that sparked a fire beneath all those pouting pilgrims!"
"Aye, it was a fine plan. I have a trumpet that blows with all the winds of Pandemonium and I thought it might do the trick. Why do you ask?"
"Beats freezing." He tosses you a wink to go with his toothy smile.

"They show up every time I visit the Hells, it seems. They'll fall right off a couple of weeks after I leave. It must be I have some fiendish blood in me. That'd explain my mother's side of the family, at any rate."
"Me? Oh, I get around. I stumbled upon all these pouting pilgrims as they were leaving Limbo and thought they could use some cheering up. It seems I have a penchant for the impossible..."
"So you're into the sensei's mumbo-jumbo, are you?" The old man tosses you a critical look.
"I might. How much is it worth to you?"
"Greetings, <FullName>. Like all who struggle in this life, I knew you would come to lay your troubles at the feet of the Sleeping Man... How is your Pilgrimage thus far?"
"Very well. Let us see if you are ready... Answer me, Pilgrim: Who is the Sleeping Man?"
"I am Dharvana, a sensei of the githzerai and a fellow Pilgrim of the Sleeping Man. I have made the journey to be by his side many times and every time I've grown in wisdom."

"Since you have asked, I shall answer. This is the first-fold mystery of the Sleeping Man, so remember it well... He is a celestial planetar, a creature of good. Like you and like I, he is a Pilgrim, traveling the planes."
"As the Sleeping Man teaches, sometimes home is not enough. One always comes in search of something. Perhaps when you find it, the path home will be more clear."
"Alas, I do not. My Pilgrims grow impatient for the journey home. They have not mastered the Five-Fold Mysteries of the Sleeping Man and have yet to grasp the nature of his patience."
"Nooo!!!! No one disturbs the Sleeping Man!"
"Welcome, <FirstName>. Be very quiet as you enter the chambers. The Sleeping Man must not be disturbed."
"You have found your answers in the Sleeping Man's dream, haven't you... Now follow them, Pilgrim, wherever they may lead."
"Yes, his is a pure soul with no trace of pride or vice or vengeance. In following him, we take on his beneficence... Now answer me, Pilgrim: From where did he come?"
"That he does. Elysium is a place of beauty and peace and perfection, yet he turned his back on it and never returned, choosing instead to roam the planes... So answer me, Pilgrim: Why did he leave?"

"He knew that without passion we are nothing and thus he journeyed many years in search of his true love. His journey brought him here, to the frozen wastes of Cania... Answer me, Pilgrim: Who did he seek?"

"The Knowers ruled this plane before the Baatezu claimed it as one of their Hells. In his wisdom, the Sleeping Man asked simply where his true love would be found... Tell me, Pilgrim: What was the answer?"

"So he returned here, to the Gates, content in the knowledge that she would find him. Weary from his journeys, he fell asleep. That was all long, long ago but still he waits here, dreaming of his true love."
"You have mastered the Five-Fold Mysteries of the Sleeping Man, Pilgrim. When you enter his chambers, wear this crystal around your neck... It will help you see his dreams."
"You're wounded. Come, let me heal you... I see your attacker was well trained. Have you any idea who she was?"
"It appears you made short enough work of your attacker... Have you any idea who she might have been?"
"Have you found her? My one true love, is she here?"
"Do not be afraid. The ring I spoke of rests just through the gate I summoned. Just fit the three parts together and the path to the Knower of Places will be made clear for you."

"That be the one. Now keep it safe and hurry, you must follow its path to the Knower of Places and ask her where you will find the Knower of Names. The glaciers may have shifted but the path is true."
"Tired of waiting, are you, Planetar? Tired of waiting and twice you've found me? Twice you've found me but only once I'll answer. I've told you that, Planetar..."
"Do not linger, my Planetar... If you must go, you must go. Your staying only prolongs my mourning."
"Thank you Donita'ar the Blessed, Light of Cania, and the agent of my freedom. Long have I waited to speak your name to you to show my gratitude."
"Thank you Lysisius the Firm, Judge of Cania, and the agent of my freedom. Long have I waited to speak your name to you to show my gratitude."
"Thank you Dretchen the Dark, Scourge of Cania, and the agent of my freedom. Long have I waited to speak your name to you to show my gratitude."
"Thank you Ebela'ar the Kind, Light of Cania, and the agent of my freedom. Long have I waited to speak your name to you to show my gratitude."
"Thank you Neuthroxus the Fair, Judge of Cania, and the agent of my freedom. Long have I waited to speak your name to you to show my gratitude."
"Thank you Nel'zeben the Selfish, Scourge of Cania, and the agent of my freedom. Long have I waited to speak your name to you to show my gratitude."
"Thank you Kagita'ar the Heartseeker, Light of Cania, and the agent of my freedom. Long have I waited to speak your name to you to show my gratitude."
"Thank you Murdus the Wild, Judge of Cania, and the agent of my freedom. Long have I waited to speak your name to you to show my gratitude."
"Thank you Ba'elzaden the Cruel, Scourge of Cania, and the agent of my freedom. Long have I waited to speak your name to you to show my gratitude."
"There is another name you wish to know?"
"Is you talking to Deekin? You not the boss, so Deekin not gots to talk to you."
"Sometimes Deekin wonder if he not spends more time dead than alive. What Deekin doing wrong, boss?"
"Ummmm... boss?"
"Oh! It is good you comes back, boss! Deekin was worried he not gets to go on rest of the adventure with you! You... you wants Deekin to comes with you now, yes?"
"Hooray! And once again the adventure of the boss and the erstwhile kobold companion continues!!"
"Hmph. Deekin beginning to think that boss is just big tease, getting Deekin all excited like that."
"Ummm... Underdark be very, ummm... dark. And scary. You takings Deekin with you now, right? You not leaves Deekin here?"
"Please don't abandon Deekin in the pits of the hells, boss! Take Deekin with you, pleee-asse?"
"You takes Deekin with you now, yes?"
"Deekin?"
"Deekin do his best! Holds on!"
"Ummm... Deekin sees dead people. In this case, Deekin sees bard lady from inn. Remember her?"
"Ooo! Look there, boss! There be dead half-orc! Right there!"
"Ummm, maybe Deekin be mistaken, but is that not dead halfling over there? It look familiar."
"That be awful lots of pillars, Deekin thinking. Maybe it be puzzle of some kind? Something to prevent you from going to next level, maybe?"
"Ummm... maybe we should lets sleeping dragons lie, boss? You not thinks so?"
"Ugggghh... Deekin not feels so good. Deekin never likes teleporting much..."
"What be this? Secret treasure room, maybe?"
"We gots him down, boss! Maybe you can talks to him now."
"Ummm... I wouldn't touch that sar--... that sarcoff--... that thing that you puts dead people in. Deekin gets bad feeling."
"It's given up! I'ts given up! Yay!"
"Uh-oh. Deekin thinking that gargoyle not just for show. Another puzzle, maybe."
"There be people here? How there be people here?"
"Hmmm... Deekin smell goblin. And where there be goblin, there be goblin traps. You should be careful, boss."
"Ooo! Here come drow lady again. Look sharp, boss!"
"Drow lady show up again. She gots good news this time, you think?"
"Mmmm... this be drow tavern? Maybe Deekin sings here? You thinks they likes that, boss?"
"So the mighty hero and the faithful kobold companion are off into the Undarkdark at long last! Adventure awaits!"
"Ummm... what be difference between stalagmite and stalagtite again? Deekin always forget."
"The Underdark is a cold and terrifying place, thought the faithful kobold companion. Then he wonder... when is lunch?"
"Hmmm. It be so dark down heres. How anyone finds way?"
"And the faithful kobold companion joined the mighty hero in creeping through the TERRIFYING Underdark! Ummm... no, too overdramatic. Is just dark down here."
"Deekin can't wait until we gets back to real sunshine. And stewed potatoes! Deekin likes stewed potatoes."
"And slowly the mighty hero and the intrepid kobold companion approached the dreaded fortress that lay ahead. Somewhere, a drum sounded ominously! Dum-DUM-DUM!!"
"Now the time had come for the mighty hero to face the dreaded beast at last. Could it be done? Could the beast be slain? Was there a fresh pair of shorts in the backpack?"
"That be some kind of fighting place? Who they gets to fight in there, Deekin wonders."
"And the mighty hero entered the realm of the dreaded illithids, full of traps that could destroy one's very mind... yes, your very mind!... with the slightest misstep!"
"Umm... there be whole lotta eyes in this room, Deekin thinking..."
"Oh, what big mess! It take someone forever to cleans up all this. Deekin hope that not be his job!"
"Oh, look! There be somebody! You goings to kill that one, too, boss?"
"And the mighty hero crept into the mage's tower, ready for anything! Magic, demons, mazes, vicious bread puddings... well, okay, maybe not vicious bread puddings..."
"What's this, now? Some kind of funny man? Deekin think we shoulds be careful, here..."
"Everybody gone, now? Back to home? Awwww. Deekin wanted to shop, first. Deekin need a new pair of shoes."
"Them's looks like duergar. Grey dwarves, they is. They might be okay, boss, but be careful. Old boss say they be very moody and not tasty at all."
"And once more the brave adventurers sauntered forth! Mmmm... sauntered? Sallied? Sashayed, maybe?"
"Ooo, there be lots of magic here. Deekin senses it! It blow us all up, maybe, that not be good."
"Oooo, it be so cold! So cold! Deekin *never* be cold, not even back in old Master's caves! Brrrrr!"
"OOoooo, yes! Fire! Fire is warm! Fire is good!"
"Ahhh, it be much warmer in here. Deekin grateful for small things, you know."
"Ummm... that lady looks a little cold, boss. Though it no wonder, with armor like that. Not practical at all."
"Ooo! Another jester! This should be fun!"
"Look, boss! See the chest? It eat all the gems. It... not seem hostile, it just seem to like eating gems."
"Ummm... river of lava? How we gets across? Deekin's feet not be lava-proof, you knows."
"Hmmm... door is made of lightning? Levers? It smell like big puzzle, boss."
"Where we be now? Ummm... maybe Deekin draws map..."
"Doom doom doom! Doom-doom doomity doom! Doom doom doom!"
"Doom DOOM DOOM! Doomity doom-doom! Doomity doom-doom!"
"It hard to write without good light, boss. Deekin need ink that glow in dark, maybe..."
"Deekin feels like he need good bath, maybe."
"Time for the doom song! DOOM DOOM DOOM! Doom-doom DOOM DOOM! Doom."
"Oooo, good thing Deekin bring flask. It so dry in here!"
"Where you goes now, boss?"
"Ehhhh... you hears that, boss? It... oh, never mind. It be Deekin's stomach only, heh heh."
"We be in the dungeon... ooooo-oo... yeah, we be in the dungeon with monsters, too..."
"What if some monster eat Deekin and you raises Deekin, boss? Would Deekin remember that?"
"How you spells 'plodding'?"
"Sometimes Deekin miss old boss. Old boss never go anywhere, he just rumble lots and get gassy."
"Ummm... is 'backpack' be one word or two?"
"Hee hee hee! Deekin almost forgets that, gee that was fun..."
"Ummm... what be that smell? That be normal?"
"Deekin not remembers... it be 'i' before 'e' or maybe afters?"
"Ooooo... Deekin hates this part!"
"The suspense builds! The music swells!"
"And as the heroes makes their way, the faithful kobold companion discovered that his underwear was riding much too tightly...!"
"And they runs along once more, the faithful kobold companion... discovering that... pebbles is sharp! Ow!"
"And as they runs along, the faithful kobold companion wonder if kobolds be delicacy to big dungeon monsters, maybe..."
"And the faithful kobold companion chases after the boss once more. Why Deekin not runs ahead, Deekin wonders? Deekin not know."
"Underdark, Undermountain... why is always 'Under'? It not feels like Deekin be under. It just feels dark and is spooky and smells like old shoes."
"Deekin so happy you takes Deekin along, boss!"
"You remembers when Deekin crosses desert with you, boss? Yeah, those is good times..."
"Doom doom doom! Doom doom doom! We is allllll dooomed!"
"What happen to mean half-orc you goes to school with? Deekin thinking he gots eaten, maybe."
"Where be Deekin's apple? Deekin swear he brings apple in pack..."
"Oh no! Deekin runs out of ink? Deekin can not runs out of... oh, here it be. Never mind."
"Eh? Where we be now?"
"How you not gets turned around, boss, Deekin never knows."
"Dum-de-dum-dum.... fame! Deekin gonna live for-ever! Da-da-da..."
"And Deekin followed the running hero once more. Run run run, run run run. Never walking, always running. One day we ride, maybe?"
"Mmmm... Deekin gots craving for something chocolatey..."
"Doom doom doom! Doom doom doom! Doomity-doom-doom! We is all doooooo-oooomed!"
"Why Deekin always follows behind? How come Deekin not gets to lead for a while?"
"Deekin gots... pebble in shoe! Wait! Hold on!"
"Oh, there's no-thing liiiike the boss! The boss is great, and won-derful! Ooooo oooo!"
"As the intrepid kobold companion continues his journey, he begins to wonder... why he not gets robe of his own?"
"Ummm... how you spells 'atmospheric'?"
"As the intrepid kobold companion continues his journey, he begins to wonder... if dragons not fly, why they gots wings?"
"Sigh. Sometimes Deekin misses kobold tribe. You nots ever misses own tribe, boss?"
"As the intrepid kobold companion continues his journey, he begins to wonder... if priests raises dead, why anybody die?"
"The boss and Deekin, faithful kobold companion, continue their voyage. The boss pretends not to notice that Deekin recently passed gas."
"As the intrepid kobold companion continues his journey, he begins to wonder... if Underdark be so big, how come surface cities not all collapse?"
"The boss and Deekin, faithful kobold companion, continue their voyage. Deekin pretends not to notice that the boss' clothes have not been washed recently."
"As the intrepid kobold companion continues his journey, he begins to wonder... why he never sees cats anywhere?"
"Heh... Deekin just thinkings to that one time you yells at Deekin. Ahhh, good times..."
"Blu-UURRRP! Oh, excuses Deekin!"
"Boss! You wants to talk to Deekin? Maybe you wants to team up with Deekin again? Deekin be great help!"
"Boss! Deekin is happy to see you is still alive! If you ever needs Deekin's help, you knows who to ask!"
"Boss! You comes to big human city! Somehow Deekin just knew you would come!"
Deekin not going to abandons you, boss!
Let the adventure continue!

Type of Feat: Class Prerequisite: Barbarian level 23+. Specifics: An epic barbarian's damage reduction allows him to ignore the first 5 points of damage from any physical attack. This ability increases by +1 point every 3rd level past 23rd. Use: Automatic.
Epic Barbarian Damage Reduction

You discovered this artifact when you were briefly trapped in the Plane of Shadows. Ever since you first picked it up, it has refused to leave your possession. Drop it, throw it away, crush it... always it immediately reappears, pulsing warmly with power as it ever does.
Its main ability that you know of is that it can teleport you to a pocket dimension ruled over by a mysterious being that calls itself the Reaper. The Reaper's dimension is a nexus of sorts.
The Reaper, not an unfriendly sort, allows you to use the relic to "bind" a location to a door in the dimension, allowing instant transportation back to that point. He will also teleport you to the dimension upon the moment of your death, saving you. The relic may only be used in this fashion, however... to bind a point or save you from death... if you have a Rogue Stone in your possession. The Reaper uses the power inherent within the gem to power the relic, consuming the gem in the process. Naturally this makes Rogue Stones even more valuable to you than they would be otherwise.
Where the Reaper comes from or how the relic stone was created has never been revealed to you. You suspect that one day its mysterious history will catch up with you. For the moment, however, it has been far more of a boon.

Rogue Stones are powerful gems that release a tremendous amount of energy when properly consumed. The Relic that has attached itself to you is able to devour these gems in order to provide you with protection from death and a limited means of teleportation.

"What is that you're writing, Deekin?"
"You must be freezing in all this cold, Deekin. Kobolds are cold-blooded, aren't they?"
"Does your fiendish heritage haunt you in this place, Valen?"
"Valen? You're white as a... as a ghost... Are you all right?"
"Must you always skulk about in the shadows, Nathyrra?"
"I'm sorry, I wish I could help you but I've already promised my sword to another."
"Excuse me but, before we go any further..."
"The Land of the Living lies through that portal... All my past failings, all my mistakes, everything I did and didn't do in life..."
"Do you feel it? The Sleeping Man, he exudes goodness... It's like being young again, like being back in the temple in Neverwinter, like being alive! You can feel it, can't you?"
"I'm sorry, but I couldn't help but see the look of shock on your face when that creature took off with your clothes."
"That tree, I recognized it!"
"So this is it, the place where the Knower of Names was banished to... Be careful. True Names hold great power and with that comes great responsibility..."
"Old thoughts of Neverwinter have been preying upon me as of late."
"I have been thinking more upon the nature of the Hells."
"Welcome back. Is there any way I can help?"
"Yes? What is it?"
"The air is cold. Let us not linger out here for long."
"Can you feel the warmth? They light the fires with berries of the Velox nettle. It is the only way to withstand the cold."
"Come, it will be a bit warmer in here out of the winds."
"I recommend steering clear of Arden, the jester there. He's a liar and a sneak if ever there was one."
"Stay your attack. It doesn't look to pose any threat and, besides, its shell seems hard as rock. I suspect it's from those worthless gems it seems to feed on."
"See that tributary across our path? It stems from the River Styx that charts its fiery course through the Nine Hells. We'll have to find some means across, though I can't fathom how."

"It appears to be a puzzle. See those levers? I think they can be pulled more than once, if that's any help. And I suspect it's that door we're aiming for. There must be some way to stop the lightning."
"I wonder if the flowers are in bloom in Neverwinter right now?"
"I wonder how large Cania is?"
"Brr. I feel like I could eat an entire bush of Velox berries right now."
"Do you really think that we will get you back to Waterdeep before it's too late?"
"Grant us safe journeys, Tyr."
"Do you think Lord Nasher still lives? He was an insufferable fool sometimes but I miss his company, all the same."
"We must stay warm. Frostbite can be deadly if it goes untreated."
"How long has it been since you freed me from the ice? I'm beginning to lose track of time."
"We have to keep moving."
"Where are we? Have you been keeping a map?"
"No, no! Please, I have children. Choose again, I beg you!"
"Go away... I can't help you... I can't have you around... Just leave me be..."
"Who are you!? Why have you come here?"
"Why can't you people just leave me alone!?"
"All I wanted was to let go..."
"Please, I surrender! What's done is done..."
"I am Lady Aribeth de Tylmarande, betrayer of the city of Neverwinter. What is it that you want of me?"
"Must you continue to torment me like this? Just leave me be."
"Bah! Must you always be underfoot, lizard?"
"It's a wonder you aren't dead yet, you cold-blooded little runt."
"How does it feel to be a trespasser in your father's house, Valen?"
"I've been watching you in battle, Valen. The demon in you grows stronger with every fiend you kill..."
"I have noticed that there are things you prefer not to speak of, Nathyrra."
"The cold has made you weak and slow. I am already in another's employ."
"The Land of the Living lies through that portal... All my past failings, all my mistakes, everything I did and didn't do in life..."
"He's watching us, dreaming about us. I can feel his mind crawling over our flesh... I don't like it here."
"To the contrary, I think I'll savor the irony awhile..."
"That tree, I recognized it!"
"So this is it... This is where Mephistopheles banished his betrayers. Eleven generals of the Blood War and a pale-faced girl. It might be worth recruiting some of them to our cause..."
"Nothing. Just old memories of Neverwinter."
"I am simply pondering the nature of the Hells, that is all."
"Oh, what's this? Have you finally come to your senses and realized you have need of me?"
"Now there's a diabolical grin if I ever saw one. What are you plotting now?"
"Beware the cold. It kills the weak."
"Velox berries. I'm afraid their scent will be burned into my nostrils for some time to come, thanks to you."
"At last, some warmth. Damn the devils and their infernal cold."
"See Arden, the jester over there? He's a pompous weasel, full of lies, but he can have his uses. Shall we go speak with him?"
"Blast, do you see that? The beast has a shell as hard as rock. It must be a result of all those worthless jewels it's eating. Regardless, it doesn't seem hostile."
"Blast, the river blocks us! We'll have to find some way across."
"Damned puzzles! Let's see... Well it appears those levers can be pulled more than once, at least. And we must somehow break through the lightning that seals that door. I'll leave the rest to you."
"If we grow hungry in the wastelands, I'm eating you first."
"If there's one thing I hate, it's this ceaseless daylight."
"My blade hungers. Surely there must be another battle close by."
"I've decided that I like the color of bloodied ice. It sets off my eyes, don't you think?"
"Do you think we'll ever get out of here?"
"What is this place? Do you know?"
"If your toes are turning black, it's from frostbite. I can cut them off with my knife if you need me to."
"How long has it been since you freed me from the ice? I'm beginning to lose track of time."
"You're lost, aren't you..."
"How may I serve you, Sojourner?"
"Your destination lies here in Cania, thus may I comply... Behold, a Gate has been opened unto you, leading to the place where you last died."
"Your destination lies here in Cania, thus may I comply... Behold, a Gate has been opened unto you that you might join with the leader of your fellows."
"Behold, Sojourner... A Gate has been opened unto you, leading to the place where you last died."
"Behold, Sojourner... A Gate has been opened unto you that you might join with the leader of your fellows."
And now you die!
This is not a good time to leave the area.
The chains will not move while the magical color sequence plays.
Your rest has been disturbed by a wandering monster.
There are no enemies within range.
"Yes, Master Sodalis."
"Strip this one and bring it to my chambers. Vix'thra grows impatient with us and we must sacrifice a victim to the pit with no delay."
"The gong has sounded. A Ceremony has been called for."
"Vix'thra turns his ancient gaze upon us."
"Mighty is the will of Vix'thra and great is his hunger."
"Vix'thra, Sage Protector, our Safeguard against all peril..."
"To thee we offer one of our own!"
"Are there any here who wish to serve the will of Vix'thra?"
"Vix'thra approves of his servant. Priests!"
"If none shall volunteer then there must be a Choosing."
"Vix'thra, show us your will!"
"Vix'thra has chosen his servant. Seize her!"
Blood we give the Elders...
Bones we give to you...
Descend, chosen of Vix'thra, and serve his will for all time.
"You have made it this far, have you?"
"You have no idea how foolish you are. You will have no chance against Vix'thra, the sacred one."
"Soon all the realms will worship him and his priesthood shall rule all the lands! Your soul will be Vix'thra's for all eternity!"
"Well that was fun, wasn't it? Evil is vanquished! Do you know if they've got another one of those stashed around somewhere?"
"This sure is a grand adventure, isn't it? Hunting down an evil god, battling drow, facing bloodsucking vampires at every turn... I could get used to this!"
"No... Please, I have no more blood to give..."
"Ungh... The pain, it hurts too much..."
"Thank you. I know I've made a mess of the whole thing but at least I'm not being held captive anymore. I don't know how I'm going to explain this to my superiors..."
"I knew you'd come back." You can tell by the moist streaks running down her cheeks that she's been crying.
"Free me!" she commands, her voice strong and fierce through her apparent pain. Her green eyes, bright as emeralds, pierce you with their gaze.
Pale Masters continue to gain spell uses per day. A wizard who becomes a pale master should purchase or find scrolls to memorize spells for these new spell slots.
A Pale Master/Monk is a potent adversary.
Come, thrall.
Now my brothers, we shall gain our Freedom!
We will begin bidding on the next lot soon.
A human female? I have yet to purchase a human thrall.
Freedom!
My mind! So empty. Must find brains!
Gaarrrrghh!
***The Intruder draws close.***
***I shall dispatch thralls at once.***
***The Intruder has not yet been stopped.***
***I shall deal with this myself!***
Something about the waterfall in front of you seems quite unreal.
Nothing seems to happen.
You have disbelieved an illusion.
This Creature was only an illusion!
There is currently no fight happening. Speak with the pit boss.
You recognize this wall of swords to be an illusion.
A Slave has reached freedom.
This is the Reaper; a dark and chilling creature who guards a plane of doors.
Pickets report the Matron's armies are only minutes away!
The Matron's armies are approaching!
The Matron's armies are very close!
The Matron's armies are almost here!
The Matron's armies are here!
I must see about our troops.
This catapult is already in use.
What have you done?
Traitor!
You've doomed us all!
We are betrayed!
Fall back! Save the Seer!
The gates are broken. The way is clear!
They've broken through!
Hang on, we'll get you out of there.
I think the worst of it is over.
Did you hear that?
They've come from the river. How?
Thus all enemies of House Maeviir shall end.
And now to end your meddling.
Thus all enemies of the Valsharess shall end.
And now enough of you and your meddling.
Goodbye, mother.
Look out! The Enemy has found a way in.
Protect the Seer!
Wait a moment.
The first of you that breaks, I will slay myself!
The outer gates have been breached!
Why aren't you other guards helping?
The Valsharess is victorious here.
We must fall back.
They are retreating. We have won the battle.
Someone is summoning creatures into the courtyard!
Get out of the way!
What are you doing!
Stupid!
You have the brains of a rothe!
Ignorant fool!
Yes Sir!
I didn't think we would make it through, brother.
* You can not use this feat while silenced *

Some weapons have the Wounding item property on them. Once a character is wounded by one of these weapons they will continue to take damage until they have been healed by potion, spell or healing kit.
Betrayer!
"<FirstName>? Where did *you* come from? We thought you were dead!"
"Mephistopheles is upon us!"
"Fall back! Fall back!"
Durnan looks at you expectantly. "Aye? Is there something you need?"
"Blast those four fools! What were they thinking? Rushing headlong into the well like a bunch of impatient children! Don't they realize how dangerous Undermountain is?"
"We must secure the portal! No more of those creatures can be allowed through it!"
"They are using my portal, dammit! *My* portal! Help us stop them!"
"Damn the infernal drow! A thousand deaths is not good enough for any one of them! Bah! At least that seems to have been the last of them... for now, anyways."
"Greetings, <FirstName>. I am glad that you made it at last. I trust your accommodations were adequate?"
"The city is under siege. Raiding parties of drow and other creatures rarely seen on the surface are attacking the city. We've determined that these attacks are coming through Undermountain."
"That's what we need to find out. The labyrinth of Undermountain was created long ago by Halaster, a mage whose power may have rivaled even Elminster himself."
"The labyrinth of Undermountain was created long ago by Halaster, a mage whose power may have rivaled even Elminster himself."
"Halaster ruled Undermountain like a brutal tyrant. It was his magic that kept the creatures within from pouring out to overrun Waterdeep."
"Now Halaster has suddenly decided to unleash his creatures on this city, and we need to find out why. I want to know what that mad mage is up to!"
"It's pretty clear that the answers we seek can't be found here on the surface. The only hope we have of stopping Halaster is to send someone down into Undermountain after him."
"I see you have finally decided to join the rest of us."
The muscled half-orc regards you quietly before speaking. "Yes? Is there something you need?"
"My name is Daelan, once of the Uthgardt Red Tiger tribe. I have traveled much of the civilized lands in the years since I left my people."
"I see no reason for us to speak with each other. I doubt we have anything more to say."
"You have returned. Is there something I can help you with?"
"I see you have survived the dangers of Undermountain... so far."
"It is good to see you again, <FirstName>. Everything is going well, I hope?"
"How... how did I get here? I remember a fight and then... only darkness. Yet you seem familiar to me. You are... an ally, yes?"
"I'm sorry, but I have joined with somebody else."
"Once again you have brought me back from the dead. I'm sorry for failing you. I... I don't know what's wrong. I don't usually go down so easily."
"May I have a word with you?"
"I see you have returned. Do you have need of me now?"
"Would you like me to join with you again?"
"Yes?"
"Sharwyn still lies where she first fell. We must find some way to restore her to life."
"There... isn't that Tomi's body. I'd recognize that rogue anywhere."
"Those pillars must be some kind of magical test or puzzle. Undermountain is full of such traps."
"Shhh... if that dragon awakes, we could be in for quite a battle."
"Another of Halaster's tricks. Teleporters make it harder to find your way through this labyrinth."
"Be careful here. Even hidden treasure might be trapped in Undermountain."
"Our enemy has surrendered. Victory is ours!"
"The stench of evil hangs upon this place. I have a bad feeling about that sarcophagus."
"She yields, she yields! The battle is over."
"I think these gargoyles may be another of Halaster's puzzles."
"These people must be slaves of the mad mage."
"This place bears the marks of goblin craftsmen... and the only thing goblins craft is traps."
"That drow returns. Be on your guard."
"It's that drow again. I'm beginning to think she may be an ally after all."
"Undermountain is a dangerous place... be on your guard at all times."
"The monsters here are fierce, but it's the traps that truly make Undermountain an adventurer's graveyard."
"Do you feel that? Eyes, watching us from the shadows."
"My axe is ready to take down any who dare stand against us."
"Doom DOOM DOOM! Doomity doom doom! Blast! That damned kobold's song is stuck in my head!"
"There's something unsettling about this place. You can taste the madness of its creator."
"Undermountain... a fitting name. I can feel the weight of the stone above us, pressing down."
"Listen! Something is following us... no, it's gone now."
"Stay vigilant. Let your guard down here and you will soon be very dead."
"The air here is heavy and stale. I miss the feel of a stiff wind against my face."
"I hear the scurrying of rats and insects fleeing before our torches... and other things, as well."
"How much deeper can this dungeon go? We must be miles underground already."
"Imagine how many bodies lie buried in here; adventurers who have entered but never come out."
"What could possess someone - even a madman - to build a place like this?"
"Though they attack us, I feel sorry for the creatures trapped in this maze."
"Our adventure here will make a fine tale for my tribe's storyteller... assuming we survive."
"I prefer battle to the uncertainty of walking these trap filled halls."
"How much worse can the Underdark be than the blackness here?"
"These cramped halls make me long for the open plains of my Uthgardt tribesmen."
"Halaster's heart must be as black and cold as Undermountain itself."
"Would you like me to join with you now?"
"Once again you have summoned me, mortal. What is it you need? Do you wish to see what items I have in stock? As you know, I carry only the finest of magical merchandise."
"Damnable drow! Why must you keep... oh. I see you aren't one of those dark elves, after all. Well, this could change a few things."
"I never liked the drow. Too demanding. Very difficult to do business with. Mortal, I am in your debt for freeing me from the clutches of those vile underground elves!"
"You again? What do you want, mortal?"
"I suppose I can accept your apology. After all, you did free me from those wretched drow."
"You really are a slow learner, aren't you? Goodbye, mortal."
"Of course. Just remember the rules: you can look, but you can't touch the merchandise until it's paid for. And my prices are non-negotiable."
"You mortals and your curiosity. Halaster was always asking me the strangest questions, though he was quite mad, of course. I suppose your own inquiries will be much less... insane."
The leader of these duergar sizes you up before speaking. "Another slaver, eh? Well, you don't want to go into Zorvak'Mur without your leader wearing one of these." He raps the helm on his head.
"Those mind flayers don't see much difference between slavers and slaves. If you aren't protected, they'll turn on you as soon as you speak to them. A free tip from one slaver to another."
One of the other duergar in the back chimes in. "What's wrong with you, Yorag? We've got the numbers advantage here. Let's pick up some more stock."
The leader rubs his chin thoughtfully. "He makes a good point. You're outnumbered... and I bet you'd fetch a nice price at the next slave auction."
"No? We was just going to let you on by out of professional courtesy. But since you ain't a slaver, this changes things." The other duergar respond with a chorus of evil laughter.
"We'll take that chance! Attack!"
"You were in that dungeon an awfully long time. It gave me a chance to talk things over with my crew. We've decided we don't much like someone else moving in on our island."
"We've been working this island for nearly twenty years. We've paid our dues in sweat and blood, and we've defended our claim against all comers. It's nothing personal, surfacer."

"We need that salvage from the Maker's lab to earn our living. We can't just let you walk off with your pick of the best stuff. We were here first, by rights we deserve a share of anything you found!"
"If you give us 10,000 gold pieces, we'll let you go on your way without any trouble. If not, we'll take what's rightfully ours by force."
"Not many come to this island, especially not a surfacer like you. What are you doing here? Have you come as friend or foe? "
"Hello once again, surfacer. Is there something you need?"
Shaori grunts in disgust. "Can't you take a hint? Go away, leave me alone! I've already told you everything I know, I've answered all your stupid questions."
"You should be out finding those mirror pieces before that drow. Or, better yet, go to the castle and get the mirror frame from the throne room. But whatever you do, just go away."
Shaori grits her teeth and snarls out, "You again? At least that drow had the decency to leave me alone after we were done yapping. Why don't you do the same?"

This winged elf wears the clothes of a monarch, though she hardly carries herself with a royal bearing. She fixes you with a mistrusting eye, then spits to clear her throat and asks, "What do you want?"
"Questions, questions, questions! I had enough of questions when I was Queen. 'Please, Shaori, tell me this.' and 'Please, Shaori, tell me that.' Why do you think I left the castle?"
"I'm not Queen Shaori anymore. I just want to be left alone. But I can't get any peace and quiet even in this cave! First Sabal and her drow come to bother me, and now you!"
"I must thank you for what you have done. You've restored the mirror and broken the spell that bound us here. My city has been returned to its rightful place among the mountains of the Lost Peaks."
Shaori gives you a regal nod by way of greeting. "Is there something else you need? If not, I will take my leave of this place as soon as you exit this cave."
The fool looks out at the carnage and bodies strewn about the throne room. "I hope once Shaori is restored she leaves the blood here in the throne room to remind her people of the folly of war."
"I cannot interfere until one of you is dead."
"Between you and Sabal we now have all the missing pieces of the mirror. At last, this terrible curse on the Avariel will be lifted!"
"I knew you would be arriving soon, <FirstName>. Between you and Sabal you have now collected all five of the missing pieces from the broken mirror. Soon this terrible curse can be broken!"
"But I see this is confusing for you, <FirstName>. If you like, I can explain what is happening."
"But first we must decide which one of you shall get the mirror. After all, you both have some of the pieces. We must decide how we will settle this."
"You've returned, <FirstName>. But I see you don't have all the missing pieces of the mirror yet. If you don't hurry, then Sabal will beat you to them."
"I was wondering when you were going to arrive, <FirstName>. No doubt you have found our town strange and confusing. Now that you are here I hope I can clear everything up for you."
The twisted little elf nods by way of greeting. "You've returned, <FirstName>. Are you ready to hear my tale now? Are you willing to help us?"
Aghaaz grins at your approach, a truly disturbing sight. "Welcome once again, <race> <male/female>. Do not worry, I have not forgotten my promise to you."
"When the time comes my golems will march with you against this Valsharess you spoke of. Or are you here for some other reason?"
Aghaaz grins at your approach, a truly disturbing sight. "Back again? What do you want now, <race> <male/female>?"
"We have no quarrel with you, <race> <male/female>. I am Aghaaz, high priest of the Maker and leader of the sentient golems on this island."

"We are the children of Alsigard the Maker, who gave us the gift of life itself. Being the strongest, the Maker saw fit to anoint me his high priest, to deliver his word and will to his other children."
"Though golems, we are different than the mindless constructs that wander the level above. We are creatures of intelligence and will, beings of true self-awareness."
"When the Maker descended to his inner sanctum, we were given the task of guarding this place from those who would destroy his work, like the duergar who loot the remains of our fallen siblings."
"But I sense you are not like those duergar thieves. It seems you have come here for a different reason. That is why we parley with you now under a state of truce."
Aghaaz screams in rage. "I shall crush you into dust!"
Ferron's rebellion will fail. Bow down to Aghaaz now, or be destroyed!
Aghaaz was appointed by the Maker. He must rule until the Maker returns.
Ferron smiles at your approach. "Welcome once again. As you can see, we are making our preparations to leave this place. It will be some time before we are ready to go, however."
"As you have no doubt noticed, we act slowly. It took hundreds of years before we reached the decision to leave this island. It will take many more before we actually depart."
"But have no fear: when you go to battle against the Valsharess, we will march with you. Or are you here for some other reason?"
"Put down your weapons, <race> <male/female>. We mean you no harm. I am Ferron, leader of these rebel sentient golems you see in this room."
"The golems here with me all share my belief: we are not slaves to the Maker. Like all creatures, we have the right to our freedom. Unfortunately our freedom will not come easily."
"This may seem strange to you, but we are not like most golems. We are not mere constructs. We can think and feel. In all ways, we are as real and alive as you yourself."
"And, like all creatures, we have the right to our freedom. The golems here with me all share my belief: we are not slaves to the Maker. Unfortunately our freedom will not come easily."
"We have fought to escape the chains of our slavery, but it is a war we can never truly win. Not without help. Please, creature, will you help us in our quest for freedom?"
"We will not let you destroy us!"
Aghaaz has no claim over any of us! Why do you follow him?
The Maker is dead! Aghaaz rules only for Aghaaz. We will never bow down to him!
This drow commander gives you a brisk salute. "Commander Imloth, at your service."
"Is there anything you need, <FirstName>? I'm pretty busy training my troops, but I can spare a few moments if it'll help you against the Valsharess and her followers."
Once again, this drow commander salutes you. "Welcome back, <FirstName>. Is there anything you need? I'll be happy to help you any way I can against the Valsharess and her followers."
"This is Commander Imloth. I have sent this wisp to act as my eyes and ears for the coming battle, and to allow me to communicate with you."
"As the battle progresses, I will report to you any happenings on the battlefield that you need to be aware of so you can direct the troops as you see fit."
"Are the defenses set, my <lord/lady>?"
"I have nothing to add at the moment."
"We have won the battle, but the war is far from over. The Valsharess' forces have found a way to cross the Dark River and attack through the Lith My'athar's port."
"They're attacking the city core, the Seer is in danger! You must go there at once!"
"We have lost the first battle, but not the war. Lith My'athar still has not fallen, and the Seer still lives."
"You have a bit of time to regroup and arrange the forces here in the City Core before the army of the Valsharess resumes its assault."
"I have no new information for you."
"I have nothing new to report right now."
"We must protect the Seer. If she falls, our cause is lost. The Valsharess' forces have infiltrated the city and will soon be upon us. What forces we have left are now gathered here at your command."
"I will try to remain near the Seer to protect her while you have free run of the battlefield."
"I must go now. Our enemies are gathering."
We can't be sure. Maybe only a matter of days.
"I am Cavallas of the Dark River. I alone can navigate its treacherous currents; all others will be swept away, or dragged down beneath its murky depths."
"I've been waiting for you."
"I hear the Dark River's voice. It whispers secrets, like the dying gurgles of a drowning man. I know why you have come."
"You seek to destroy the Valsharess; her death is your release. I can help you with this. I know the secrets of the islands; the Dark River whispers them to me when I glide across her waters."
"Do you seek passage across the Dark River? There is no other who can guide you safely. Those who try have all drowned, and their bones have since been swept away."
"I know much about the river's black waters, I know something of the islands these waters surround. But about your world - the world of earth and dry land - I know little."
"The islands of the Dark River are places of secrets; places of power and danger. In these places you might find something to aid you against the Valsharess and her great army."
"But though there are many tiny islands, there are two of particular note: the Isle of the Maker, and an island that is now home to a strange town that appeared from nowhere."
"I am Cavallas of the Dark River. I am navigator, guide and keeper of its secrets. And I alone can take you to the islands you must visit."
Freedom or death!
"I was a fool to trust you. Now I pay the ultimate price."
A drow thrall steps up to greet you, his head held high. "Where is the warden? Who are you?"
"Why are you still here? I have promised to give you time to reach the Elder Brain before I launch the revolt, but I won't wait forever. My freedom can't be denied."
A gleam of wild hope appears in his eye. "Dead? I am Argosus, leader of these thralls. Are you here to set us free, or do you also serve the illithid?"
Kill them all!
May the darkness claim you!
I will drain you!
Death to you all!
Now! I need healing!
To my aid, damn you!
Our victims await…
Abandon the cause and regroup!
You dare to face me? Then let it be your doom!
Fight by my side!
Sheathe your anger! Now!
My spirit fades…
Gah! Something courses through me!
Nothing!
This worthless blade!
I suggest you follow…
What's this?
Gather here!
Out of my way.
Deal with these locks.
Search the place.
Into the shadows!
It can be done.
Impossible!
There, it's done.
I am not your pack mule…
What is it?
What now?
Perhaps.
I would doubt it.
Halt!
How long do you intend to drive us? It's time we rest.
The hourglass empties yet we do nothing…
Good riddance.
Yes, well… Thanks…
Tyr's folly…
Score one for the dark!
Lend me your ear!
Let's do it.
Hmph. If you say so…
One wrong move and I will scour the hells with your blood…
Lay the devils low!
For the glory of Tyr!
An end to this evil!
For Neverwinter!
Healers, I need your aid!
Rally to me!
There lies the foe!
Fall back that we might take them from the flanks!
I have paid for my crimes. You cannot harm me!
Stand guard over me! We must not fail!
Hold your fire! Let us give this battle pause!
I am not well…
A poison runs through me…
My spells, they fail me!
My blade rings false!
Follow me, then. I shall lead the way.
Over here. Do you see this?
We must gather together. There is safety in numbers…
Excuse me, I must pass…
I'm afraid it's locked.
Search the place. I think there might be something here.
Hide yourselves.
I can do that.
I'm sorry. It can't be done.
There, that should help.
I'm sorry but I bear a heavy burden…
How can I help?
Welcome.
Of course.
No, I'm afraid not.
What is the meaning of this?
If we intend to keep our health, I suggest we rest.
Time is not on our side. Let us not waste what little we have.
Journey well.
You have my thanks.
By the hells!
All praise to Tyr!
May I have leave to speak?
I agree, that sounds like the wisest course of action.
I don't know. I don't like the sound of it.
I have endured more torments than you could ever dream of… Don't try my patience.
Show them no mercy…
Bones for Vix'thra!
Blood for the Elders!
Sacrifice!
I bleed…
To me, my minions!
It's not over!
Welcome.
Of course…
Of course not…
Goodbye, then…
That will show them!
Listen here…
Bones for Vix'thra, blood for the Elders…
Our enemies will be destroyed!
You will perish!
For the Avariel!
You cannot win.
I need healing.
Please - I need aid.
I bid you greetings.
Of course.
No.
Farewell.
That's the way to do it!
I must speak with you.
You will regret that.
The battle is joined!
Death from above!
My enemies fly before me!
For the Avariel!
My wounds are great… I need healing.
Please, I need assistance.
Greetings.
Yes.
No.
Goodbye.
Well done!
You must listen to what I have to say.
You just made a big mistake!
You will drown in your own blood!
The Dark River take you!
Death silence you!
Your secrets die with you now!
I grow weak… somebody, heal me.
I have need of aid.
Welcome.
Of course.
I'm afraid not.
Goodbye.
Victory!
I have secrets you must hear.
The Dark River will swallow your soul!
Let's get them!
Taste my savage fury!
The rage of the Red Tiger unleashed!
For the Uthgardt!
Quickly - I need healing.
I need aid!
I see our foe.
Time to make a quick escape.
Do you dare attack me, cowards?
Protect me.
Hold your positions.
My injuries are grave. I need healing quickly.
Poison? I feel… unwell.
My spell has failed!
My attack - it has no effect!
Follow me.
Over here. I've found something.
Quickly - attack formation!
Step aside so I may pass.
Open this lock.
We should search this place.
We must move quietly now.
I shall do as you ask.
I have failed in the task.
It is done.
Strong as I am this burden is quite heavy.
You need something?
Well met, friend.
Of course.
No.
Stop!
Perhaps we could rest now.
For adventurers we seem to be doing little adventuring.
Farewell.
I thank you for this.
By Uthgar's Blood!
Hurrah!
May I speak with you a moment?
An excellent idea.
Are you certain?
Beware lest you incur my wrath.
Kick them! Ooh, make them hurt!
For divine justice!
Why you little…
I'll kick you to hell and back, I will!
Ouch, ouch, ouch! Make it stop!
Help! Over here!
Hi!
You bet your bottom!
No way!
Toodle-oo!
Oh yay!
Hi! Excuse me. Hello?
Don't you dare! I'll sic an angel on you, I will!
I love a good fight!
How'd you like that?!!
This is going to hurt!
You're finished!
I'm hurt bad here.
Someone better give me a hand.
Yes?
Sure.
No.
Bye.
That's the way!
I've got to tell you something.
You'll be sorry.
Time to spill some blood!
You're going down!
Feel the pain!
Taste my steel!
Someone fix up my wounds!
Give me ahand here.
Yeah?
Okay.
Nope.
See ya.
That's the way!
Listen up.
Don't even think about it.
Get the hell out of my inn!
Fall, foul creature!
They won't last long!
Die now!
I will die without some healing.
To me!
Greetings adventurer.
Yes?
No.
Fare well.
Yes! Victory!
I would speak with you.
You won't walk out of here alive.
Lay death at their doorstep…
Hark, the bell, it tolls for thee!
Death will set you free!
Shuffle off your mortal coil!
I am at death's door and can hear the knocking…
It is time you aid me…
Hail the dead.
Aye.
Nay.
May your spirit make its journey…
Peal the bells!
Hear me, all those with ears to hear…
Death is your only destiny…
Feel my power!
Fear my wrath!
Here comes the pain!
Time to die!
I need healing - now!
Give me some help!
And so it ends…
Greetings.

Vendui', surfacer. I greet you. Are you aware of who I am?
So you have made your decision. You are a fool, surfacer.
Die, then, with the rebels! I shall see you on your knees before me... and then you shall truly know what it is to suffer!
You have chosen wisely, surfacer. You need continue your charade with the rebels for only a short while before my army arrives at Lith My'athar. Do not give yourself away.
I shall remove the geas I see that you are under now. After that you need only remember: the gates must be opened when my army arrives.
Now I will remove this foolish geas Halaster placed you under. After that is done, you need only remember: the gates must be opened.
You will not regret your decision. Ensure that I do not regret mine.
It seems your... information... is proving worthwhile after all, dread Mephistopheles.
The one you warned me of is reported to be within the Underdark now, working alongside the ragtag rebels who yet dare to oppose me.
You shall call me Valsharess! I have summoned and bound you, Mephistopheles, and you will bend to my will as you must!
I desire to know how this surfacer arrived in the Underdark so quickly. I desire to know exactly where this surfacer is.
And most of all I desire this surfacer dead!
Beyond *your* power, Mephistopheles? I would like to know how that is!
Continue to search for the surfacer. I *will* find him. And when I do, both he and every last one of those wretched rebels will pay!
Continue to search for the surfacer. I *will* find her. And when I do, both she and every last one of those wretched rebels will pay!
Our surfacer has grown to be a considerable problem. Why is it that you have not done as I have commanded, Mephistopheles? Why does the surfacer yet live?
No, I will not believe it! I will not have it!! I have bound you, foul devil, and you will do as I say!!
So you say. If you are attempting to elude me, Mephistopheles, I will discover it. You are mine to command.
This surfacer has proven elusive, too difficult to eliminate. Perhaps there is... something to what you say. Perhaps there is more here than meets the eye.
You. Male! Send for my commanders. I desire their presence now!
I will gather all my remaining forces, if I must. The rebels must be dealt with, and the surfacer... will hide from me no longer.
It seems our surfacer friend is with the rebel forces still, and has drawn near the fortress. Good. Use your power, dread Mephistopheles... bring the fool to me.
It appears my new ally is victorious. Excellent! Bring the surfacer to me, Mephistopheles. I would like an audience.
I will end this threat to me now, once and for all. I shall prove you wrong, devil... no one stands in my path!
There is much for us to do yet, but with the surfacer at our side... all becomes possible!
"So we meet again, foolish one. This time in the flesh."
Vendui', my ally! I apologize to bring you here without warning, but I could not wait another moment for this meeting. Come, let us celebrate our victory!

Ha-ha ha ha! Do you see? The archdevil Mephistopheles has caged you with his power... a power that is mine to command, for I have caged him. He is my hound on a leash, and with him I shall become a goddess!
"Welcome to my fortress. It is good to meet finally face to face."
"Allow me to introduce the dread archdevil Mephistopheles to you. Come, Mephistopheles... give my ally a proper greeting, I command it."

"I have done the impossible, you see. I have bound this fool devil to me as my servant. Like a hound on a leash, all of his hell-spawned power is mine to command. With your power added to his and mine, we are unstoppable!"
"We have much to discuss about our future, you and I. Follow me, then, and we shall do so in private."
Mephistopheles! I command you to show this fool surfacer what true pain is! Bring the wretched creature a slow and agonizing death... I wish to watch, and enjoy.
What?! What... what are you doing?! I command you to stop at once!!
"Hold! Why are you two conversing? What are you trying to do, surfacer? Speak! I demand to know at once!!"
"Do you think me a fool?! You seek to usurp my control, steal my power! Jal khaless zhah waela! All trust is foolish! I shall not make that mistake again!"
"Mephistopheles is bound to me, cretin! He cannot betray me... not as you can. Jal khaless zhah waela! All trust is foolish! I shall not make that mistake again!"
"And I should have known better than to trust a lowly surfacer. Jal khaless zhah waela! All trust is foolish! I shall not make that mistake again!"
"Mephistopheles! I command you... destroy this surfacer! My Red Sisters, slay this fool now!!"
How dare you oppose my will! You are mine to command! I have bound you, you *cannot* disobey!!
The situation is grim. How long do you believe we have?
Do you not recognize one of our own? Nathyrra, you have returned.
And you. But I see you have returned with another... someone very important, indeed.
Lith My'athar cannot survive this siege much longer, Matron Myrune.
You have to order the House Maeviir troops to press the attack.
What... what do you mean?
What? You cannot believe the Valsharess' lies.
We are betrayed! The enemy is within the walls!
"You are most welcome here, <CUSTOM500>. I am the Seer. I have awaited your arrival with great anticipation. Please, come... do not be alarmed."
"I am sure you have many questions, and I assure you that they will be answered. I am curious first, however, as to how you came to appear before us."
"I am sure you have many questions, but there is much we must tell you first. It is important you know something of the Valsharess, if you are to help us against her."
"I believe it is time for our guest to learn more of the Valsharess, herself. Nathyrra, if you would be so kind...?"
"She summoned a powerful Duke of the Nine Hells, an archdevil she bound to her service. Drawing on this enslaved devil's power, she became a conqueror of the Underdark."
"That we do not know. Perhaps through some artifact or some long forgotten ritual. But whatever her methods, the results cannot be denied."
"As each day passes, the Valsharess's hold over the Underdark strengthens and so does her power."
"It involves you because she wants you dead."
"I had the same dream," the Seer sighs. "For whatever reason, destiny has singled you out as the instrument of the Valsharess's defeat."
"There is only one thing that I can do. I must put my faith in the goddess... and that means putting our faith in you. Our fate lies in your hands."
"I trust all goes well. Have you any news to report? Have you made any progress in your efforts to weaken the Valsharess and her followers?"
"It is good you are here, <FullName>. The army of the Valsharess is on the move. They are marching on Lith My'athar."
"I am glad to hear you say that. It is time to make our final stand. I have been given another vision... a vision of you leading our troops against the Valsharess."
"No, it is time for us to make our final stand. Our fate will be decided here. Eilistraee has shown me a vision... a vision of you leading our troops to glory."
"You have proven yourself worthy of this honor, <FullName>. Even House Maeviir will follow your orders in the coming battle."
"We will make preparations all through the night. In the morning the enemy will arrive and the battle will begin. While we do this, you must rest. We will wake you before the battle starts."
"This is your destiny, <FullName>. You cannot escape it. You have proven yourself worthy of this honor; even House Maeviir will follow you in the coming battle."
"I should have seen the Maeviir betrayal coming. I've been so focused on the Valsharess, that I failed to notice the enemy right beneath my nose."
"The enemy has been driven back from the gates, <FirstName>. But another wave of attackers is already striking through the Ports."
"The Valsharess must be growing in power. This is an ill omen, <FirstName>. You must go there right away. The defenders of Lith My'athar need you now more than ever."
"I believe the siege of Lith My'athar is over, <FirstName>. The main army of the Valsharess has retreated. You have driven them back, and the Valsharess is on the run!"
"Fortunately for us, your arrogance is matched only by your power and skill in battle."
"Your modesty is matched only by your courage and skill in battle. But even with all you have done, your task is not yet complete."
"The enemy drow have pulled out of Lith My'athar. They may be planning a... wait, do you hear that? No... it cannot be!"
"We must press our advantage before the enemy has time to recover from this defeat. You must lead our forces against the stronghold of the Valsharess and end her evil once and for all!"
"Yet again you have proven yourself, and once more you have shown the vision of Eilistraee to be true. None of the Valsharess' forces can stand against you."
The battle goes well, my friend. With your help, we have been victorious thus far. It is not over yet, however.
The Valsharess's fortress lies ahead. We must find a way to storm it if we are to end her tyranny once and for all!
Gone? No, this cannot be!
"Hello, dear. I trust everything is well with you."
"I can still feel my death, hanging on me, cold and eerie. I am glad to be back in this mortal realm again." She rubs her arms as if cold, looking distracted and somewhat distraught.
"May we speak, dear?"
"Undermountain is a dangerous place. I suspect you need someone of faith to guide your way, yes?"
"It is wonderful to see you again, dear. Have you a need of me?"
"Hello there, dear. What can I do for you?"
"Would you like something else?"
"Then may Sehanine guide my hand."
"Is that Sharwyn? Oh my! We should help her!"
"It's Daelan! And he's been killed! Please, let us help him!"
"Ah, it seems Tomi did not get very far. And it was I who insisted on sending him here alone."
"Do you think these pillars are some form of puzzle? How odd. I feel as if we are being tested, somehow."
"Beware the sleeping dragon. If we are to wake it, we should be prepared."
"I... always feel disoriented after being teleported. Just give me a moment, please..."
"I think the little rodent has led us here. My! Aren't you an intelligent little creature!"
"He has given up! Let him surrender! Please!"
"I... don't have the senses of some damnable thief, but I do think there is danger here."
"She's surrendered herself! Please, just... let her be for a moment."
"The statues are part of some greater puzzle, no doubt. Just be careful, dear."
"I am NOT clumsy! ...well, all right, I am not THAT clumsy."
"The smell of goblins here is... nauseating. How could such tiny creatures survive here in Undermountain?"
"Oh! It's Nathyrra again! She is *so* quiet!"
"Here is Nathyrra again. It is good to see she hasn't been hurt!"
"Oops! I think I knocked something over!"
"I don't want to step into any traps. I seem to do that too often."
"Oh my! Did you hear that? Oh... maybe it was nothing."
"Why did they put me in a sarcophagus? Were they going to eat me later? Hmmm... I don't want to think about that..."
"Sehanine guide us through this terrible place."
"This dungeon smells of... old death. I can't imagine anyone actually living here."
"There seem to be bodies everywhere. What poor souls met their fates here?"
"How many heroes have met ignoble ends in these halls? It is sad to think about."
"The good Durnan actually survived this place. Now that I've seen it my respect for him increases."
"Just be careful where you step, dear. I can heal you, but I'd rather you just didn't get hurt."
"I would never have pictured myself doing this back at the temple in Evereska."
"Oh dear. There went my heel. Sigh..."
"Sehanine give me courage to walk into the shadows..."
"It already feels as if we are miles under the earth. To think that the Underdark is even further down... it seems unbearable to consider."
"I'm not sure... are we here to *rescue* Halaster or not? He... created all this horror, after all..."
"I've been told the drow are related to my own people, but... sometimes I just can't believe it."
"Oops! I spilled something on my armor..."
"Where did my symbol go? Did I drop it again?"
"I've been told that these mind flayer creatures actually eat your... brain. Isn't that a horrifying thought?"
"We've got to help all those poor people up in Waterdeep! They're counting on us!"
"Quickly! We must aid Durnan, or all shall be lost!"
"We must destroy this evil before it kills everyone here! Please help us!!"
The elven cleric nods to you and smiles pleasantly as you approach. "It is good to see you again."
"You are welcome amongst us, dear. I understand everyone here has been awaiting your arrival with great anticipation."
The cleric's holy symbol marks her as a priestess of the elven goddess Sehanine Moonbow. She nods respectfully to you. "Blessed be, my friend."
"We have been victorious! One blow struck against the evil that threatens this city!"
"I do not want to talk to you. You are cruel and nasty and spiteful and... and mean! Please, just leave me alone."
"Back again, dear? Is there anything you need from me?"
"I see you made it out of Undermountain safe and sound. I suppose that's a good thing."
"Welcome back. It's so good to see you again, dear. I trust things have been going well? I've been praying to Sehanine to watch over you."
"Are you... are you real? Or are you one of those Rakshasa in disguise? No... that makes no sense. They killed me, they would have no reason to bring me back to life."
"Don't get in front of me! I'm trying to remember everything that's going on, you know!"
"Don't talk, just... just hit something!"
The striking woman chuckles as you approach. "Good to see you again."
"Ah, yes. You would be the one our dear innkeeper has been waiting on before he begins. How good of you to come."
The striking woman smiles at you brightly. "Is there something I can do for you?"
"This shall make a grand tale!"
"There's no real purpose in us speaking to one another, is there?"
"Back again? Something I can help you with, perhaps?"
"Still alive, I see."
"This... this is Undermountain! How did I...? What happened? Did I die? Who are you?"
"Hello, there. A rather enjoyable adventure this is, isn't it?"
"I don't think I will ever become accustomed to the idea of returning from the dead. My memories of what happens before you come back are so... hazy. I wonder why that is?"
"A moment, if you would."
"Undermountain calls, I see? Do you need my assistance once more?"
"It is good to see you once again. Do you have need of me?"
"Yes? Is there something you need?"
"Is there something else, then?"
"So be it!"
"Now *this* should be interesting."
"Aw, look. It seems we have a dead barbarian on our hands, now."
"I think I see Tomi's body, there. You aren't going to raise him, are you?"
"How interesting... these pillars are, no doubt, part of a puzzle erected to bar our progress through Undermountain. Halaster seems to have made this entire place a... a deadly lunatic maze."
"Careful. I don't think we want to wake up the beast without preparing properly."
"Halaster's very fond of teleporting, I understand. Let's just... not try using them too often. I don't want to end up teleporting inside a dragon's belly, you know?"
"Ah-ha! The rat has led us to treasure, it seems. Isn't that always the way?"
"He has surrendered! Question the ogre while you can!"
"Hmmm. I sense a definite trap of some sort, here. Be wary of the sarcophagus."
"She's surrendered. There's no need to continue fighting her... perhaps we should parley?"
"Perhaps the statue is part of another puzzle? Let's take a closer look, shall we?"
"What's this? Common folk here inside Undermountain? How very strange."
"Can you see the traces? It looks like goblins in this area. We'd best be careful... for goblins to survive here, they'd have to be very cunning."
"It is the drow, returned to us again, it appears."
"Nathyrra has come back, silent as ever."
"Why do dungeons always have to be so blasted cold? I'm freezing."
"Did someone write graffiti here? Hmmm... ahhhh... no, I guess that would be just a stain. Huh."
"I'm trying to think of how this adventure would be put to music... but I can't get that kobold's blasted 'Doom Song' out of my head."
"Hmph. I should have picked up some new boots."
"Have you ever tried drawing a map by torchlight? This is so frustrating..."
"You know what Elminster says about Undermountain? 'The largest known mass grave in Faerun today.' I believe it."
"I wonder what happens to the dead in here? Is there some kind of... of eco-system? Or does magic take care of everything?"
"Halaster must summon creatures to fill his maze. There's no way such different monsters could exist so close to one another."
"How sadistic and mad would Halaster have to be to... to *live* here?"
"Wait... did I mark this on the map right? Damn it!"
"You know, I began adventuring to be famous. Yet I always seem to end up traveling with someone who takes the credit."
"Just watch. I'm going to write some great song down here and then die horribly just so it can be found by some talentless bard years from now and *he'll* become famous."
"You know what? This dungeon seems very clean to me."
"The fact that Waterdeep, the largest city in Faerun, is RIGHT OVERHEAD --- that just blows my mind."
"To think we got here through a well in an inn... a bit odd, isn't it?"
"I've heard there's a city in the Underdark if you go beneath the dungeon. It's called Skullport... I wonder if it's involved in all this somehow?"
"Dried blood. More dried blood. Bones. Yick."
"Hmmm... is this off-tune? I can't decide."
"I must admit, the thought of mind flayers... those things with the tentacles on their face... they give me nightmares."
"Can you imagine if we actually receive the reward? All that gold... what would one do with it?"
"Don't start yappin'! Fight, already!"
"What are ye standin' about yammering? Kill somethin', will ya?"
The halfling smiles brightly at you. "Hey, now! Something else ya need?"
"Oi! I think everyone's been waitin' on you. About bloody time ye popped down here."
The halfling rogue appraises you with a fair amount of disinterest before finally belching in an almost challenging manner. "Yeah? Ya wants somethin', I bet."
"Yeah! If that's all that bloody Undermountain has t' throw at us, then there's nothin' but smooth sailin' ahead!"
"Well, if it isn't Tomi's very own personal savior! How's it goin'?"
"Dyin' makes ya bloody hungry, that's all I gots ta say. Nice ta see ya again, by the way. Thanks for the raise an' all."
"Dyin' makes ya bloody hungry, that's all I gots ta say. So did ya decide you needs Tomi Undergallows to travel with ya, now?"
"Ha! I knew you'd come around eventually! You hear that, world?! Tomi's back on the road!!"
"Well, I'll be a nekkid monkey's uncle. Did I die again? And I was just about to gut the bloody bastard, too, wouldn't ya know it?"
"Aye? Don't suppose there's some reason for us ta chat, is there? Naw, didn't bloody well think so."
"Am I glad to see you! I expect the gods're gettin' tired of seein' me. They're going ta start thinking I'm just taunting them, ya know."
"Oy! Listen up!"
"So... ya need Tomi's skills again? Undermountain has a lot of traps, ya know. Better we pair up than go it alone."
"Right-o! Off we go!"
"So are we off, aye?"
"Eh? What can Tomi do for ya?"
"Something else ya need?"
"Oy! Either that's Sharwyn over there on the bloody floor or corpses in general are lookin' a lot better n' usual."
"Don't look now but I think we gots a half-orc barbarian corpse on our hands."
"Bloody hell!"
"Ya know, the bloody wizard who made this place just loves ta put puzzles like this in your way. I s'pose we'll have to solve this thing now, aye?"
"Right. Sleepin' dragon ahead. Ya wants t' wake it up nicely or rudely?"
"I always love a good teleport. Gets ya in places ya can't sneak to, ya know?"
"It's always best ta figure that a rat knows the way to treasure, aye?"
"Oh, look. He's gone an' given himself up now. Too bad fer him."
"Mehh... might want t' hold on, here. I gots a bad feelin' about this place."
"She surrendered? I say cut 'er wings off! Hah-ha ha ha!"
"Blasted bloody statues. What do ya want t' bet that it's part of some puzzle? I hate these things."
"Oh, it's these folks again. Still don't trust 'em."
"Can ya smell that? That's goblin turds, that is. Bloody smart buggers, sometimes, though they're probably no match fer you."
"Oy! She's back again, look sharp!"
"Damn, but she's good. I didn't even bloody well pick 'er out that time."
"I wonder where me old friend Sammy has gotten off to. I sure do miss 'im."
"You reminds me of someone I met in Neverwinter. I ever tells ya that?"
"Just another adventure to round out me fulfilling career, I always say."
"Oy now! Don't get too far ahead! I can only run so bleedin' fast, ya know."
"So-oooo... hmmm... I wonder how much a map o' this place would go for..."
"Brandobaris's bloody feet! Does it ever smell in here, phaugh!"
"Hmph. Every dungeon looks the same."
"Where's me damn picks... oh, there. Why'd I put 'em there?"
"Oh. lovely... what'd I step in now?"
"Crimeny... where the bloody hell are we?"
"Alright. Update the map... this thing'll be worth a fortune..."
"Oy! I hate it when there's miles o' rock over me bloody head, don't you?"
"Bloody traps everywhere. I'd love ta throttle the crazy mage who made this place, aye?"
"Ya ever wonder why they don't just get an army and invade this place?"
"An' all this was underneath Waterdeep the whole bleedin' time. I thought it'd be a bit smaller, meself."
"Oy! What's that? Oh... just another rat."
"If I dies again, don't ya bloody leave me down here, aye?"
"Monster blood. There ain't nothin' that stinks quite like it."
"Ya think we'll be going down t' the Underdark? I been there before, ya know."
"What in bleedin' blazes is on me shoe? Gahhh! It's a right squishy one."
