"You are within my fortress, of course, brought here by the power of the archdevil bound to my service. You are now my guest... and my prisoner."
"But I already have. If you do not believe me, then come... approach me if you dare."
"Such bluster! What a pathetic female you make. Like a lowly male you are not even aware of your true situation."
"Such bluster! What a glorious male you are! You should have taken my offer when you had the chance. We would have been magnificent together!"
"By all means, then. Come... kill me if you dare."
"I am afraid that it is. You are in no position to negotiate, here. If you do not believe me, then come... approach me if you dare."
"What do I want? Ha-ha ha ha! I want you within my power. I want to make you suffer before Mephistopheles destroys the rebels. I want to see the Seer weep as she is the last to be crushed!"
"And you are indeed within my power, surfacer. If you do not believe me, then come... approach me if you dare."
"Am I? Perhaps so, though you are certainly in no position to kill me or anyone for that matter. You are now my guest... and my prisoner."
"Oh? I suppose it might seem that way, to you. Before I unleashed Mephistopheles upon those pitiful rebels I wanted to deal with you, first... my guest and my prisoner."
"An alliance? Certainly not. You had your opportunity and you threw it away. No, fool, now you live only at my sufferance: my guest and my prisoner."
"Ha-ha ha! You are wise to be suspicious of me, surfacer. This one time, however, I mean exactly what I say. I am in the mood to celebrate."
"Impatient, are we? I see I will have to keep a close eye on you, indeed. This shall be an... interesting alliance."
"That is my secret to keep, dear ally. Do you believe I would consider handing over the control of my pet to anyone, even to you? Certainly not!"
"Ha-ha ha ha! It would be a... challenge... to try to tame you, surfacer. I think not, however. I have tamed this fool devil, and that is enough for anyone."
"Now what kind of talk is that from my best ally, hmmm? I see I will have to keep a close eye on you, indeed. If you wish to know what keeps me safe, however, then I will tell you."
"Indeed. We have all the time in the world to discuss such matters, ally. For the moment, I am in the mood to celebrate."

<CUSTOM0> : Successfully saved versus Devastating Critical
As you desire, great Valsharess.
And so she is dead. You have done well, mortal.
"Indeed I was. But there are rules and even older rules that I must obey, all of which supercede the bindings the fool drow placed me under. Not that she knew of this."
"She may have summoned me, but to command me to slay one who is an extension of myself... that was beyond her power. A pity."
"That would be *you*, mortal. Ever since you found my relic within the Plane of Shadow, you have been bound to me as it has been bound to you. A most fortuitous event, in my eyes."
"Is that what you call it? The relic is a piece of my own flesh, meant for the leader of my priesthood on this plane... but obviously it was destined to be found by you, instead."
"Through it, I called you here, confident that your power could challenge even that of the Valsharess... and I was correct. I am always pleased when a gamble turns out well."
"I am free. A great lord of the devils able to roam amongst the mortals and bring suffering to them as I wish, with not a one who possesses the power to stop me!"

"I would begin with you, dear mortal, but since we are bound so closely that would not be prudent. Instead I will send you someplace you may not interfere. And the relic... that I relieve you of now."
"I wish you well in the Hells, mortal. You have proven... most useful."
"Alas, I have other plans."
"You think to battle me? My dear mortal, no... did you not listen to a thing I said? We are bound, you and I. You could no more slay me than I could you."
"Planned to get summoned and bound by a lowly drow? No, of course not. Think of yourself as an unexpected resource I had available to me... and I used you to free myself from this wretched slavery."
I shall *not* do as you desire, great Valsharess. Instead... instead I shall slay your precious Red Sisters.
A moment, mortal. I would speak with you.
You are a foolish mortal, drow, like any other. You know not the powers you tamper with! Now pay the price!
"Tell me, mortal... is this the true path you choose to follow?"
"You intend to stand by the Valsharess, do you? You believe a jealous drow will share all that she has with you, another female?"
"You intend to stand by the Valsharess, do you? You believe a jealous drow thinks herself an equal to a lowly surfacer male?"
"You may be useful to her for the moment, mortal, but when the time comes she will betray you. Surely you know this."
"Ha ha-ha! I do like your thinking, mortal. A most delightful mind you possess. Surely the rest of what I have to say will not surprise you."
"Indeed you are not. Look at what this drow has already reached for and tell me she would not still make the attempt, regardless of the risk."
"And why not? You have already listened to hers, now listen to mine. Decide for yourself which of us makes the most sense and has the most to gain."
"Why do that? Ask yourself honestly if the drow has given you any reason to believe her at all? Are you truly so gullible?"
"She fears you, mortal. She has seen the future and knows that you could destroy her. Do you think her pride would allow you to exist one moment longer than you needed to?"
"Yours is the destiny to possess true power. You need share nothing with the drow. Take it! Take it for yourself! I would gladly serve one who is truly worthy!"
"Ha ha-ha! The difference between what the drow knows and what she thinks she knows is vast, mortal. Do not make the same mistake as she. What do you say to my offer?"
"Then you are a fool, mortal, for what comes next is inevitable."
"You are... most wise, mortal."
All is as I said it would be, Matron Mother.
Of course, great Valsharess. What is your desire?
The one you seek is beyond my sight, great Valsharess.
It is as I have already spoken, great Valsharess, I --
I cannot do what is beyond my power, great Valsharess.
I am, as you say, yours to command.
"As you desire, great Valsharess. I greet you, mortal, at the behest of she who has bound me."
"I shall *not* do as you desire, great Valsharess."
"Ah, the fool mortal returns. Imagine my surprise at meeting you here. Last I recall, had I not trapped you for all eternity in an icy little place called Cania?"
"Try what you might, you cannot stop me, mortal. I know you far too well."
"My... My True Name! You've commanded me!? Where did you learn it?! Rrraugh, but I must obey! ...What... What is it you wish of me, <Master/Mistress>? How must I serve you?"
"Rrraaaaaugh!"
"Yes, <Master/Mistress>! Of course! As you command, all evil will be purged from my soul..."
"Yes, thank you <Master/Mistress>! Thank you for your mercy! May frozen Cania be my home forevermore..."
"A henchman? ...It is as you wish, <Master/Mistress>. I will follow you into every danger and we shall walk, homeless, across the planes..."
"Now what were we discussing, mortal? Oh yes, I remember now... Friends... How quaint."
"Yes, we'll rule together. As equals... Friends... Yes, we'll share it all... Nothing will stand in our way!"
"Your lackey. Yes, <Master/Mistress>. I will bend and scrape... I will serve you and you will rule the Hells of Baator in my stead..."

"A... A chambermaid, <Master/Mistress>? But I was meant for greater things! You would reduce me to turning down bed sheets and emptying the chamber pots of drunken mortals? ...It shall be as you wish..."
"I gave you all of Cania for your realm yet still you covet what I claim as mine? You ungrateful little toad... It is you who will be replaced, not I!"
"The Knowers? Damn you, <Master/Mistress>, you leave me with nothing... Very well, Cania is theirs, and Baator's Hellish claim on it is hereby forfeit! It is as you command..."
"Ungh! I can fight you... no more..."
"Good evening, m'lady. Do you come here often? ...Forgive me if I seem gauche but, last I recall, I had trapped you for all eternity in an icy little place called Cania."
"It appears you have been my downfall, mortal... I underestimated you. Next time I won't make the same mistake..."
"Repent of what? Everything I have done I would do again, if only I had the breath left in me to make it so... A curse upon your lineage, mortal, and every place you lay your head..."
"For good or ill, I surrender any claim upon this world to you. Do with it as you will, if you have the power... Now on your honor, I beg you to let me go..."
"Nor I yours, truth be told... Very well, you have fought me fair and spared my life. You will not see me again..."
"Banished to Cania, home and exile all at once... Very well, you have fought me fair and spared my life. I will abide by your decree... Farewell, mortal, you have seen your last of me..."

Matron Myrune laughs. "Of course Zesyyr wants to kill me. I'd be disappointed if she didn't. But she lacks the ambition and the power to act."

The magically enhanced drow piwafi cloak is one of the most important accoutrements of a drow's possession. Even the most common of these cloaks carries a most powerful enchantment to protect its wearer. All drow long to own a piwafi; though, only those who have proven themselves useful, or who come from rich, powerful families can afford to own one.
This nearly transparent cube travels slowly along dungeon corridors and cave floors, absorbing carrion, creatures and trash.
Activate Item (Touch)
Wounded
Epic Superior Weapon Focus

Type of Feat: Class Prerequisite: Weapon of Choice, Epic Weapon Master. Specifics: The Weapon Master gains a +1 bonus to all attack rolls with their weapon of choice at 13th level and every three levels afterwards. This bonus stacks with the Weapon Master's Superior Weapon Focus feat. Use: Automatic.

The first known creation of this type was by a powerful devil, Maligothez, who stripped the flesh from an enemy demon, Llargash. Maligothez bound his rival's flesh to the bones of a troll and then animated them, creating a powerful construct of pure malevolence. Although Maligothez was eventually destroyed by rival devils, his creation survived his death and killed most of its master's attackers with a ferocity that impressed all devil-kin. The creation of other, similar constructs has become something akin to a sport on certain levels of hell.

Potion bottles can be used by characters with the brew potion feat to create magical potions of any beneficial spell of 3rd level or lower that can be targeted on the caster. In order to create a magical potion, the caster needs to target the bottle with the spell he wants to brew a potion of.

Blank scrolls can be used by characters with the scribe scroll feat to create magical scrolls of spells they know. In order to scribe a scroll, the character needs to target the blank scroll with the spell he wants to scribe onto the scroll.

Bone wands can be used by characters with the craft wand feat to create magical wands of any targeted spell of 4th level or lower. In order to craft a magical wand, the caster needs to target the wand with the spell he wants to craft into the wand.
"My name is Ashar, the Valsharess' hand. Through me she sees all that transpires on the battlefield. My mistress is pleased you have chosen to join us in our final push into Lith My'athar."
"The battle is all but over, and my mistress has one last order for you: find and kill the Seer!"
"The battle will only end once we find and kill the Seer."
Aaahhh!!
All you followers of Eilistraee are doomed!
The armies of the Valsharess will crush you all!
Soon you will feel... wait. What's that sound?
Nau!! Elghinn! Nau!
"So! You have rescued me from an existence of boredom. How can I ever repay you?"
"Yes? What do you wish of me?"
"Hmmm. I'm not really sure. I noticed that, myself."
The sword snorts in indignation. "Need I remind you that I did not start off my existence as this weapon? And that the only other being to wield me was quite devoid of any health at all?"

"The only thing I can think of is that the sword must be... draining you, somehow. Powering itself up through your life-force, just as it heals you with the life-force of your victims. A symbiotic relationship, of sorts."
Ha ha! For glory and blood!
Oh? Is it that time again already?
Very well, but loosen your grip. I am beginning to feel manhandled.
Time to deal death once more, I see.
Bwaha-ha ha ha haaaa!
Putting me away already, are you? Sigh... so be it.
Must you stick me back in that smelly scabbard?
You know, I would really prefer to see what's going on.
Thank the gods. Do you know how sweaty your palms are?
Don't forget to oil and polish me this time.
Foul-tasting thing! Hit it again!!
Hacking dumb animals, are we?
Immune to magic, hey? We'll see about that!
Ah, yes! A dragon! Slay it, we shall!
Ha! Let's cut its beard off once it's dead!
I used to summon these all the time...
I love the taste of elf blood in the morning, oh yes!
Take that, you little strumpet!
The bigger they are the harder they fall!
I so despise gnomes!
Take that, half-breed!
A half-orc once bullied me! I hated that!!
Couldn't you just step on these creatures?
Ahhh, human blood! How I miss it so!
Blech! What a horrid taste!
Orcs! There's always orcs!
Remember to wipe the scales off later!
Careful! These outsiders can be tricky!
Shapeshifter! Kill it quick!
The essence of undead is so... so vile!
Why must I debase myself striking such vermin?!
Time for you to die!
Finally! Some excitement!
Hit it! Hit it again!
Ahh! It is good to feel the juices flowing once again!
Father always wanted me to be a fighter...
Ha-ha ha ha ha haaa!
Mwaha-ha-ha-haaaa!
Funny how I don't mind the sight of blood anymore...
Oh, hit it again! I *do* so love that sound!
Watch out! I don't want to get chipped!
Just don't drop me, whatever you do. The ground looks dirty.
Ha ha ha-ha! I am the death dealer!!
Is it time to see some internal organs again?
OH! A solid blow!
Take that, fool!
You simply must remember to polish me after this.
Hmm. Is it dead yet?
Oh, will you perish already!
Nice hit. Bravo!
Ahh! Not the face! Not the face!
"You there! Yes, you! Take me out of this brute's hand and away from here! I swear, if I must suffer one more decade staring at this room I shall go mad!"
The sword sighs heavily. "Far be it from me to make a simple request and hope that an adventurer might do as they are asked, for once. No? Fine. Let's start this out correctly, shall we?"
"My name is Enserric the Grey. Or, at least, that was my name before my spirit was drawn into this blasted weapon. Yes, yes, chuckle away at my predicament, go ahead."
"You see, I was once an adventurer just as you are, seeking my path through infamous Undermountain. When I was killed by this sword, my soul was sucked inside and here I have been ever since."
At my command, strike!
True power shall win the day!
Prepare to fall, fool!
You will not be victorious!
I require healing for my wounds! Quickly!
To me! I need assistance!
No! It cannot be!
Well met.
So shall it be.
I think not.
Until we meet again.
True power has won the day!
Hold! I wish to speak with you.
You shall curse the day you crossed my path, pathetic fool!
Spellcasting henchmen, like Deekin, can be used to buff up the entire party before a difficult battle. Just talk to them.
A low armor class means certain death. Make sure you and your henchmen have high armor classes by using rings of protections, amulets of natural armor and defensive spells.
When you shapeshift, review your cast spell menu. Forms such as elementals and mind-flayers have access to some special powers.
Use light gems to give your magical items the ability to glow brightly.
Please insert the Neverwinter Nights: Hordes of the Underdark or the Neverwinter Nights Platinum Edition Play disc.

You tear the webs out of your way.
The warmth from the last potion is still with you.
The warmth from the last potion has nearly left you.
The warmth from drinking the potion is very soothing in this bitter cold.
Use the Relic of the Reaper to place binding locations that you can teleport to. This makes moving around easier, but each binding consumes a Rogue Stone.
Look in the Pool of Lost Souls in the Reaper's realm for items left or dropped by henchmen who are no longer with you.
After hiring a henchman or gaining a level you should rest, to refresh yours and theirs abilities.
If you have less than AC 30, you are going to die in combat. Often.
Your henchmen may look cute in their skivvies, but please put armor on them. They will live longer.
Spell Mantle and similar spells are useful in that they make you virtually untouchable by enemy spell-casters.
The enemy will use invisibility to hide themselves and buff up. Be prepared to counter them with Dispel Magic, See Invisibility or True Seeing.

Your henchmen have a variety of abilities. Please consult their character sheets to view the list of their current skills and feats, so that you may equip them with the weapons that they will use most effectively.
Wearing a helmet when fighting Illithids will make it harder for them to use their deadly Extract Brain attack.
An intricate outline of a dragon is etched on the surface of this obviously magical container.
The Elder Brain dies in a shower of gore and cerebral fluid.
Pseudodragon

Pseudodragons resemble miniature red dragons, but are red-brown in color rather than deep-red. They have fine scales and sharp horns and teeth. A pseudodragon's tail is about 2 feet long (twice as long as its body), barbed, and very flexible.
This magic bow has a bonus to attack. As well, it allows the wielder to add part of his strength modifier to the damage dealt.
"I'm sorry, but I'm working with someone else now."
"Thank you for raising me. I am no stranger to death, but it is always alarming when one is forced to confront one's own mortality."
"Do you have a moment? There is something I wish to tell you."
"The Underdark is a dangerous place, particularly for surfacers such as yourself. My experience here could prove useful. Would you like me to join you once again?"
"You need someone with cunning to watch your back in this treacherous realm. Maybe it would be best if I joined up with you again."
"Would you like me to join up with you again?"
"Yes? Is there something you need?"

The bottle begins to shake and tremble in your grasp. A cloud of smoke billows forth, the mists coalescing into the figure of a powerfully built man.
The bottle begins to shake and tremble in your grasp. A cloud of smoke billows forth, the mists coalescing into the figure of a powerfully built man.
"I am no slave! I am a descended from the Royal House Arsetis. The drow couldn't force me to serve them, and neither can you, mortal!"
"Allow me to introduce myself: I am Volkarion Arsetis, a powerful djinni of royal blood."
"You mortals have some strange preconceptions about us. Every time I cross paths with one of your kind, you seem to think I'm obligated to give you a wish."
"Unfortunately for you, it doesn't work that way. But I am grateful for my release."
"A reward? Well, I suppose something is in order. But first, allow me to introduce myself: I am Volkarion Arsetis, a powerful djinni of royal blood."
"You mortals have some strange preconceptions about us. Everytime I cross paths with one of your kind, you seem to think I'm obligated to give you a wish."
"Unfortunately for you, it doesn't work that way. But I am grateful for my release. Allow me to introduce myself: I am Volkarion Arsetis, a powerful djinni of royal blood."
"I do have something I can give you as a reward; a trinket Halaster recently gave to me for safekeeping. I suspect he didn't want the drow to get it, but I'm sure he won't mind if I give it to you."

"This is an activation stone for a magic portal that will allow you to move between Undermountain and Waterdeep. I seem to remember Halaster saying it was in the eastern section of Undermountain's second level."
"Well, aren't you a fiesty one. Most mortals aren't stupid enough to look for trouble with a djinni. But you did free me, so I guess I'll give you another chance."
"There is something else I could do for you; an offer that could help us both. I was getting very tired of dealing with the drow. And now that Halaster is missing, business has been a bit slow."
"I like you, mortal. There's something different about you, something unique. And business has been a bit slow for me since Halaster disappeared."
"I'm going to do you a favor, mortal. I'm going to allow you to have access to my shop, a store virtually overflowing with magical merchandise."
"Yes, of course. I imagine you're quite busy. Very well - I will return to my shop and we can conclude this business later on."
"I don't think you appreciate what a rare opportunity you're being given."
"I'm a merchant dealing in rare and powerful magical items. I wander the planes collecting wondrous artifacts, then I sell them to a few very select clients."
"Halaster himself was one of my best customers. That's why I agreed to let him create this summoning bottle. Whenever he needed to see my inventory I was only a quick rub away."
"Of course, ever since the drow got their ashen fingers on the bottle I'm being summoned twenty times a day. I would never have agreed to this if I knew Halaster was going to be so careless."
"The power of the bottle compels me to respond to each summons, and keeps me from taking any hostile action against the owner. But it doesn't mean I have to do business with them."
"The dark elves are beneath me. I won't do business with them. I keep my list of customers very exclusive. Since you've liberated my bottle from the drow, I'm going to add you to that list."
"Then I shall return to my work. The planes are full of rare and wonderous items, and I am constantly looking to add to my inventory."
"If you need me for anything, just use the summoning bottle. You can use it three times each day. No matter where I am in my planar explorations, I will answer its call in mere seconds."
"I don't see how that would even be possible. If you attack me, I'll simply vanish from your little plane of existence. There's nothing you could really do to stop me."
"If you really feel the need you can try and harm me, but you'll only be wasting your time. You'll find it much more profitable if we do business together. I'll leave you to think about that."
"Ha-ha! Of course you do, mortal. We Djinn are an item of endless fascination for your kind, aren't we? Very well, ask what you will."
"It's not the gold itself that I value, but what it represents. Gold is precious to a mortal. To part with it is a sacrifice. My items are expensive: purchasing them is a great sacrifice to you."
"By giving me the gold, the value of the sacrifice - its worth to you - is then transferred to me. It's all very complicated, I don't expect you to fully understand."
"All that should matter to you is that I have established my prices for my items, and none of my prices are negotiable."
"I have spent many centuries journeying through the planes, seeking my fortune. And in my travels I have come across many magical items... items that my kind have little use for."
"But you mortals find such items to be quite useful indeed. Rather than letting these items go to waste, I decided to sell them to those who had need of them."
"Of course, dealing with mortals is difficult. That is why I have chosen my customers with great care. A powerful arch-mage like Halaster is a worthy client, an apprentice conjurer is not."
"That may have been misleading, mortal. All Djinn are of royal blood, in some fashion. And while it is true my family's house is well respected, I am far from the seat of power."
"If you were to compare my place in the hierarchy of my kind to your own class system, I would be nothing more than a wealthy merchant."

"The reasons behind the actions of you mortals are almost always the same: greed, the hunger for power, the desire to conquer. I imagine the drow are bent on personal gain at the expense of everyone else."
"However, I don't know any specific details. Why the drow specifically chose this time and place, and what they have done or intend to do with Halaster are as much a mystery to me as you."
"Not much. I know Halaster created it, and I know from personal experience that he was quite proud of his creation. But the work of mortals holds little interest for me."
"I can only speculate, mortal. Halaster always kept the summoning bottle on his person, so I would surmise the drow somehow obtained the bottle directly from the wizard."
"But I doubt Halaster would have willingly turned the summoning bottle over to them. The mage has the same dislike for the Dark Elves as I do."
"I suspect the bottle was forcibly taken from him, which means Halaster must now be a prisoner of the drow... if he's still alive."
"Try disappearing on me again and I'll destroy you!"
"You will obey me, djinni! I own you!"
"I'm sorry we got off on the wrong foot."
"This isn't a rescue - you're my slave now!"
"Who are you?"
"A djinni? Does this mean you'll grant me a wish?"
"So is there some kind of reward for rescuing you?"
"A djinni? Then I order you to do my bidding!"
<StartCheck>[Intelligence]</Start> "Are you a djinni? Does this mean I get a wish?"
"You better come up with something better than a lousy rock!"
"Is that it?"
"Thank you."
"I don't have time for this."
"That doesn't sound like much of a reward."
"Your shop? What are you talking about?"
"That's all for now."
"I want to ask you something else."
"Why didn't you just destroy the drow?"
"Why didn't you just stop answering the summons?"
"I'd like to see your inventory now."
"No, that's all for now."
"I think I'll just kill you and take your inventory!"
"I want to ask you some questions."
"Tell me about your store."
"I want to know more about you, Volkarion."
"I want to ask you about something else."
"Why run a store? What use does a djinni have for gold?"
"Why did you decide to become a merchant?"
"You said before you are of royal blood?"
"Do you know why the drow have come to Undermountain?"
"What can you tell me about Undermountain?"
"Do you know what happened to Halaster?"
"Let me see what you have in stock."
The Reaper stands before you, cold as ice. Distant flames flicker in the mirror of his face. You shiver in spite of yourself.
"You are barred from the Prime Material plane. If you are about to ask me to return you there, I'm sorry but I cannot comply."
"Your death took place in the Prime Material plane. I am sorry but you are barred from there and I cannot comply."
"Of course, Sojourner. If it is one thing we have here, it is time."
"The devil, Mephistopheles, has commanded me with my True Name. Commands thus given none can disobey."
"These are the names given us by the gods themselves. They have great power in the Planes and, as you can imagine, they are guarded jealously by those who know them."

"Alas, that is another wish with which I cannot comply for Mephistopheles has bid me to never share it. But yes, if you commanded me with my True Name to send you home, I would have no choice but to comply."

"There is one Gate here that was always sealed to you before. It leads to the surface of Cania and the City of Lost Souls that gather there. It is open to you now. You had best go there and make yourself at home."

"To my knowledge, none but myself and Mephistopheles who spoke it to me. One cannot tell and the other you cannot ask... I am sorry, Sojourner, but you must spend the rest of your days trapped here in Cania."

"Mephistopheles used you, as is a devil's nature. He formed a bond with both you and the Valsharess and drove you against each other. In the moment that you killed her, he took your place and you, his."
"He traded your freedom for his chains. Once he was bound here as you are now but, through his trickery and deceit, he has escaped through the bond he formed with you."
"This bond. The bond of death, the bond of life, the bond of power, the bond that has brought you here to me so many times. It was a devil's bargain and one you never knew you made."
"You are barred from the Prime Material by decree of the devil, Mephistopheles. This is Cania, the Eighth Hell of Baator and in this place he is Lord of all."
"Of course, Sojourner. If it is one thing we have here, it is time."
"Much though it pains me, I am my master's servant. What Mephistopheles commands, I must do."
"No, I cannot, though not through fear of retribution: I am a child of this hell and know its torments well. Instead, he has commanded me with my True Name. Commands thus given none can disobey."
"These are the names given us by the gods themselves. They have great power in the Planes and, as you can imagine, they are guarded jealously by those who know them."

"Alas, that is another wish with which I cannot comply for Mephistopheles has bid me to never share it. But yes, if you commanded me with my True Name to send you home, I would have no choice but to comply."

"There is one Gate here that was always sealed to you before. It leads to the surface of Cania and the City of Lost Souls that gather there. It is open to you now. You had best go there and make yourself at home."

"To my knowledge, none but myself and Mephistopheles who spoke it to me. One cannot tell and the other you cannot ask... I am sorry, Sojourner, but you must spend the rest of your days trapped here in Cania."
"Yes, the Eighth Hell, the Frozen Wastes of Cania, the Dreaded Depths of Baator. Whatever name one gives it, it remains the same and, for you, it is a prison."
"Mephistopheles used you, as is a devil's nature. He formed a bond with both you and the Valsharess and drove you against each other. After her death, he took your place and you, his."
"He traded your freedom for his chains. Once he was bound here as you are now but, through his trickery and deceit, he has escaped through the bond he formed with you."
"This bond. The bond of death, the bond of life, the bond of power, the bond that has brought you here to me so many times. It was a devil's bargain and one you never knew you made."
"To the contrary. There is no such thing as home for one such as you. You must forget what you knew of the Prime Material for you are never going back."
"You are barred from there and I cannot send you... I am sorry, Sojourner. That in me which still has life now mourns for you."
"The Spirits of the Dead can end up in all sorts of places. The outer planes are infinite in their variety and who can say where a soul will go."

"That said, I can use the gates to summon them here if you so desire. But they will come or not, each according to their desire. I cannot compel them to come here in the same way I have you. Who shall I summon?"
"Of course, Sojourner. If it is one thing we have here, it is time."
"The spirit refuses... I sense anger and hatred directed at you, Sojourner. He feels wronged by you and will not answer my summons. Is there anyone else you wish me to summon?"
"Consent is given. His spirit travels the gates now, hurtling towards us, and flesh is now forming... your companion returns to you."
Valen suddenly appears, as whole as the last time you saw him. He looks around, mildly bewildered. "So I am summoned from beyond the veil once again. To stand at your side, <FirstName>?"
"I am glad to be here with you, then." He turns and regards the Gatekeeper. "And you, strange one... it was you I felt calling me, yes? You're the one who brought me to this... place?"
"Yes, fiendish one. <FullName> has requested your presence here in the hells... Now, Sojourner, is there anyone else you wish me to summon?"
"The spirit refuses... I sense anger and hatred directed at you, Sojourner. She feels wronged by you and will not answer my summons. Is there anyone else you wish me to summon?"
"Consent is given. Her spirit travels the gates now, hurtling towards us, and flesh is now forming... your companion returns to you."
Nathyrra suddenly appears, looking startled. She draws one of her daggers almost without thinking. "What... where am I?" Her eyes focus on you. "<FirstName>? So I am... alive once more."

Slowly she nods, comprehension coming to her. "Thank you for bringing me back, then, my friend. To have died in battle was unsettling, to say the least." She looks around. "And what is this place? Are we in the planes?"
"Yes, dark one. <FullName> has requested your presence here in the hells... Now, Sojourner, is there anyone else you wish me to summon?"
"Consent is given. His spirit travels the gates now, hurtling towards us, and flesh is now forming... your companion returns to you."

Deekin suddenly appears. Strangely, he does not seem surprised nor disturbed by his situation. "There you is, boss! Deekin keeps telling angels that he gots lots to do, that he not stayings up there, but they not believes him!"

<StartAction>(sigh)</Start> "Deekin be right all along, just like Deekin says. Stupid angels." He looks around a bit, taking in the chamber. "Ummm... is we in hell, boss? Place needs good cleaning, maybe."
"Yes, little one. <FullName> has requested your presence here in the hells... Now, Sojourner, is there anyone else you wish me to summon?"
"The Sleeping Man is wise and old. He passed through the Gates of Cania when they were first formed, long before the time of we Gatekeepers. Yet here he remains, asleep and waiting even now."
"I watched him sleep when I was young and there, carved about the dais where he sleeps, were the words 'She will find you by the Gates of Cania.' And thus he waits."
"Death or a maiden fair, who can say. The words are there, in answer to a question he must have asked. That is all I know."

"You have learned my True Name, I see... Very well, I have summoned a door that will return you to the one you know as Durnan, in Waterdeep. But, before you go, is there anything else you would have me do?"
"A word of warning before you go, Sojourner... By breaking Mephistopheles' command and stepping through that door, you forfeit the gift he has given you."

"You will not see me again nor lay your eyes upon the ice of Cania. When next you die, there will only be the blackness of the void. But have no fear, for the same will be true of Mephistopheles... Now go."
"Consider the Devils of Cania unleashed, m'<Lord/Lady>, but once set loose upon the mortal realm, they will not be easy to rein back in. Even so, I shall comply. Anything more?"
"If that is your wish, I shall make it so. Even death itself will no longer hold the spirits here. Is there anything else you would ask of me?"
"As you command, Sojourner. I will return them safely to their home in Limbo. Is there anything else?"
A hooded figure stands before you, cold as ice. Distant flames flicker in the mirror of his face. You shiver in spite of yourself.
"The Gates lead many places, each can be bound to a location you specify by using your relic. You may use all of them but the one that is wreathed in mists. That one is not yours to use."
"I am not allowed to say."
"Because it is the wish of your benefactor... I have given my word and it is sacrosanct."

"This is the Gatehouse, an entry point into the Land of the Dead. You are welcome here but I do not recommend you linger. Your heart still beats and life still beckons to you from through the veil..."
"You need but ask, Sojourner, as I have been commanded to obey."
"I am known as the Reaper, the Collector of Souls, the Gatherer of Dust, the Gatekeeper. You have left the Land of the Living."
"You have a powerful friend who has requested that I return you to the Land of the Living before death can take its hold."
"Your powerful friend has requested that I not name them and thus I obey. For the time being, at least, they wish to remain your anonymous benefactor."
"Goodbye."
"I need to ask you something."
"I must go to the leader of my adventuring party."
"I have died and wish to return to where I fell."
"Back to my other questions."
"Why can't you comply?"
"What's a True Name?"
"What is your True Name?"
"What do I do now, then?"
"Who knows your True Name, then?"
"Mephistopheles? But I was fighting the Valsharess."
"What do you mean he took my place?"
"What bond?"
"Who says I'm barred from there?"
"Back to my previous questions."
"Why didn't you tell me any of this before?"
"Can't you disobey him?"
"What's a True Name?"
"What is your True Name?"
"What do I do now, then?"
"Who knows your True Name, then?"
"The Eighth Hell?"
"Mephistopheles? But I was fighting the Valsharess."
"What do you mean he took my place?"
"What bond?"
"But the Prime Material is my home!"
"Why am I never going back?"
"What of my companions who died? Where are they?"
"Back to my other questions."
"Summon forth Valen."
"Summon forth Nathyrra."
"Summon forth Deekin."
"I seek the Five-Fold Mysteries of the Sleeping Man."
"What is he waiting for?"
"Who is 'She'?"
"Hecugoth the Abandoned, I command you to grant me passage home!"
"Thank you, Reaper. That will be all."
"Allow the Devils to wreak their havoc on the planes."
"Allow the Spirits of the Dead to haunt the Living."
"Allow the Githzerai Pilgrims to return home."
"Goodbye."
"Look at all these doors! Where do they lead?"
"What lays beyond the door wreathed in mists?"
"Why can't you say?"
"Why can't I use the door wreathed in mists?"
"Who is this benefactor?"
"Where am I?"
"How do I return?"
"Who commanded you?"
"Who are you? How did I get here?"
"So... I died?"
"Who is this 'powerful friend' of mine?"
"I must go to the leader of my adventuring party."
"I have died and wish to return to where I fell."
"As you wish. Now go find something to hit, I'm thirsty."
"You're asking a sword for advice? Here's some advice: don't do that."
"How about going to a city, somewhere? I haven't seen a beautiful, scantily-clad woman in... hmmmmm... a long time..."
"Swing harder. And keep me sharp."
"Don't get stabbed to death by soul-sucking weapons. And if you do, don't try dumb plans to get out of said weapons. So sayeth the sword."
"Don't die. Simple advice, I know, but effective. I should have followed it myself."
"Quit adventuring, have some children. I don't know... what do you want from me? I don't dispense advice, I kill things."
"You could work on your grip, I think. I seem to constantly feel about two seconds away from being flung off to the right during combat."
"I've seen better days."
Enserric sighs heavily. "If you must know, I've spent the better part of the last day trying to remember the name of my daughter."
"In life, I was a wizard, possessed of an intelligence that outshone anyone else I had ever met. I was a proud man, and it is... troubling... to lose even such a thing as a name."
"I suggested to you before the thought of how I might simply be an echo within this weapon, did I not? Do you remember?"
"You have your own memory problems, I see. Or a short attention span. Regardless, it occurred to me that what you are speaking to is simply an 'imprint' upon this weapon... and a fading one."
"Well, part of me wonders if my old comrades didn't get out and have me properly raised. The real Enserric the Gray might still be out there, unaware I exist."
"That is a... disconcerting feeling, the idea that I have no real existence."
"I am a weapon now, I suppose, and shall remain one until my consciousness dissipates." He ponders that for a moment. "In a way, that is a bit liberating: I am a sword and nothing more."

"So go and use me, then, if you will... kill as many creatures as you can and with each death I'll have a little of my revenge. I am an implement of violence... and so violence I shall deal! Ha ha ha ha-ha!"
"You mean try to see if there really is another Enserric the Gray? Or if there was? No... no, I'm not certain that is something I would like to know."
"Hmph. Let's stuff you inside the next club we encounter and leave you alone for a half-century or so and see if your disposition improves. No? I didn't think so."
"I never was much of one for weapons when I was alive. Indeed, I used my crossbow occasionally, but it was always a bother."
"Have you not been listening to a thing I've told you? My memory is fading, bit by bit in here, and there is nothing I can do about it."
"No. Not truly. She would not thank me for such a meeting, as I was neither a kind father nor even truly about. And she would be old, now, even were she alive."
"Hmmm," he considers for a long moment, "the real trouble would be the lack of my body. I suppose I could always be transferred into another body, however."
"Ha ha ha-ha! And what shall I do, dear <man/woman>? Wrestle you for it? No, you're quite safe on that account, never fear."
"The only thing I could think might be possible would be for my spirit to enter a construct of some kind... perhaps a golem or some such, preferably well-made."
"How such a process could even be performed, however, is beyond my knowledge now. I've forgotten much... which does bring up the possibility that I am not whole enough to leave."

"Indeed. I have lost so many details of my memory over the long years I am almost certain that I am... dissipating from within this blade. One day I shall be gone entirely, or merely a wisp able to communicate only via empathy."
"But it needn't concern you, dear <man/woman>. I somewhat look forward to such a day. Either I will be finally and truly dead or... or senseless enough I will no longer care."
"You're kind to say so, dear <man/woman>, but it's not so bad now that I'm away from that skeleton. At least I'm no longer bored. Go kill something exciting and I'll feel much better, I assure you."
"Indeed. On the bright side, there are worse things than being a sword. I could be a... a cookpot! Or a pair of smelly boots. Bleh."
"Do not trouble yourself, truly. If fortune smiles upon me and something drops in your lap... well, that would be fine, but otherwise I am not waiting for the gods to intervene."
"That's very possible. And that means it's unlikely I could ever escape this sword, really... how many soulless bodies do you encounter, hmm? Not many."
"Now, now, it may not be as bad as all that. Keep in mind that the effects are only temporary, yes?
"How unhealthy are you?" The sword snaps. "Maybe you could... but I doubt the sword would ever make you *that* unhealthy. Mind you, I've no way of being sure of that..."

"Hmmm," the blade considers, "I'm still drawing power from you overall, so yes... I'd say that's likely. But at the same time I will also become a more powerful weapon. It's a trade-off, of sorts, isn't it?"

"Now... let's not be so hasty! I could always try to reverse the process and give you back your life-force... but that means losing the stronger enchantment on my blade. Keep in mind as well that these effects are likely only temporary."
"I... might be able to, yes. But that would mean losing the stronger enchantment on the blade, as well. Keep in mind that these effects are likely only temporary."
Enserric offers up no comment, but mumbles something about ungratitude in general.
"As you wish," the sword sighs unhappily. "Let me know if you want this to happen again. I'll try to restrain the sword's... enthusiasm... and other times."
"Never mind?" The sword whistles in appreciation. "Well, this may be easier than I thought! Let's move on then, my new comrade-in-arms!"
"Oh?" The sword sounds suspicious. "What did you want to know, exactly?"
"It's dangerous."
"The last time I explored any of it was fifty years ago. What do you expect? That I could still draw a map for you? I wish I could help."
"No, not really. The blade I exist within is quite well-enchanted... and it draws the life force from creatures it attacks within to heal the wielder."
"Beyond that, no surprises I'd expect. Mind you... I've never been wielded by anything except that skeleton so far. This is a new experience for us both."
"Not really, no. You can see how far I made it into the dungeon, no? Whatever treasure we had was dragged off by my so-called comrades after I died."
"Hmph. I swear, if I encounter any of those fools, I'd be quite pleased if you used me to hack them up instantly, no matter how old and feeble they've gotten!"
"Well," the sword hesitates for a moment, "I am a bit... embarrassed... to admit it, but I seem to have forgotten most of the details."
"I've been in this sword for nigh on fifty years, at least! The details of my life have become... fuzzy at best. Oh, I know who I was, more or less, and that I was a wizard. No more."
"I remember I *had* spells. And I know what they were called. But, like I said, the details are gone." He sighs heavily. "Truly it's distressing."
"Mmmm... would they be still alive, I wonder? Most of my comrades would be fifty years older. That's if they did not perish in this very dungeon after abandoning my body."
"I have a daughter, but she... she would be as old as I was. No, older. No doubt she would not even remember Enserric the Gray, sadly. I... was not around much."
"No, I'm sorry to say my old life is done. I should be dead... in fact, I most likely am and I am but an echo of what once was. Fascinating thought, don't you think?"
"No, I'm sorry to say my old life is done. I should be dead... in fact, I most likely am and I am but an echo of what once was. Fascinating thought, don't you think?"
"Naturally. That's what I'm here for, now that I'm a sword. Lovely existence really... living life on the edge! Ha ha. The puns are endless, let me tell you."
"Well, there is *that*. I admit I'm a bit sad that you're so eager to be rid of me, but at least it's better than measuring the layer of dust on my blade."
"As you wish! Lead on, my good <man/woman>!"
"Never mind."
"Any advice you can offer?"
"You all right in there?"
"You don't sound very happy."
"This must be difficult for you."
"Not really."
"Yes."
"I agree. I wish there was something I could do."
"Maybe I could try to see if you're right."
"That's all I need. A bellyaching weapon."
"But you do exist. As a weapon."
"Why is it difficult to remember?"
"Do you want to see her again?"
"Is there any way to get you out of this sword?"
"You're not getting mine!"
"Is that even possible?"
"Not whole enough?"
"That's horrible! I'm so sorry."
"Fair enough. No need for me to bother thinking about it, then."
"I'll try to free you if I can."
"Such a body would need to be soulless, perhaps?"
"Tell me more about your mortal life."
"I want you to boost the enchantment on the sword."
"You appear to be affecting my health. Why is that, exactly?"
"What do you mean you're not sure?"
"I'll learn to live with it."
"Could I die from this?"
"Will it get any worse?"
"I suppose I'll just have to sell you, then."
"Can you do something about it?"
"Forget it. Maybe you're worth more this way."
"Never mind, then. I'll keep the enchantment for now."
"Alright. Remove the effects for now, then."
"Never mind."
"How about answering some questions?"
"I don't need to know anything else."
"What can you tell me about Undermountain?"
"No, really."
"Do you have any secret powers I should know about?"
"Do you know where there's treasure around here?"
"Tell me more about your mortal life."
"Forgotten?"
"Do you remember any spells?"
"Is there anyone who would miss you?"
"You can service me as a weapon, that's how."
"You can bring a good price at the market."
"Good. Let's go, then."

There are a variety of materials in the world that you can find. These material can be made into either weapon or armor components depending on their nature. Once an item is transformed into a component, it can be used with other components to make items such as daggers, armor, ammunition and so on.

The raw materials are bolts of cloth, leather hides, elm planks, oak planks, large bones, iron, steel, and feathers. These components are generally obtained by slaying creatures or destroying objects.

These materials can be transformed into either large or small components. Large components include: Leather Armor Torso, Elmwood Bow Shaft, Oaken Crossbow Shelf, Oaken Weapon Grip, Oaken Pole, Oaken Shield Body, Steel Plate Armor Chest, Steel Chain Armor Tunic, Steel Shield Body, Steel Weapon Hilt, Helmet Pot, Projectile Shaft, and Woolen Cloth.

Small components are used on large components to choose the final item to craft. This list contains some of the small components: Leather Patches, Leather Strings, Iron Spikes, Iron Chain, Iron Rings, Iron Bands, Small Steel Blade, Large Steel Blade, Woolen Cloth Pads, and Iron Hammer Head,

The Relic is an odd, many runed device. The inscriptions engraved on its surface reveal the hidden truth of its possible manipulations.
You may not delete bind points at the moment because you have not placed any.
You may remove bindings, stripping the magical field that guides the Relic's teleportation magic away. This allows you to place a new binding, elsewhere.
You may not jump anywhere at the moment because you have not placed any bind points.

By teleporting back to the Reaper's realm, you can use one of five magical doorways to return to a location that you have previously bound yourself to. You can also return to the starting location of your adventure.
Bindings allow you to teleport back to a destination you have already visited. You may place up to five bindings. One rogue stone is required for each binding.
The Relic can place as many as five bindings wherever you choose. These bindings may be teleported back to at anytime.
Placing a binding will require one rogue stone. Teleporting to a binding has no additional cost. You must have a rogue stone in your inventory to place a binding.
There is no binding to jump to. Place a binding by manipulating the Relic.

You recognize this drow as Rizolvir, the drow smith from the Seer's rebel camp. He gives you a grin and says, "I didn't expect to see you down here, <FullName>. Welcome to the Hells."
"I was killed during the siege of Lith My'athar. Not sure why I ended up here, exactly... maybe the Eighth Hell just needed a good weapon smith."

"It's not so bad. I've been able to rebuild my forge, drawing heat from down here below the ice. I've already crafted enough items to restock my inventory and, while business is slow, it's better than nothing."

"The clientele are a bit different: devils and githzerai instead of drow. But other than that, the more things change, the more they stay the same. At the heart of it, I'm still selling and upgrading weapons."
"Back again, <FullName>? You here to check out my inventory? Or do you want me to upgrade your weapon? Or is there something else?"
This drow smith looks up from his forge, his face streaked with sweat and soot. "You're that surfacer the Seer's been waiting for, aren't you? I wondered how long until you wandered over my way."
"My name's Rizolvir, master craftsman and weapon smith extraordinare. And you're <FullName>, right? Pleased to meet you."
"If there's anything you need, I'm here to help. Feel free to look over my inventory. Or, if you want, I can upgrade your weapon for you."
"Goodbye, <FullName>. If you ever want to buy or upgrade any weapons, you know where to find me."
"Goodbye and good luck, <FullName>. We're counting on you."
"Armor and weapons, mostly... though weapons are my specialty. Plus, I can upgrade existing weapons. My prices are quite reasonable considering the circumstances."
"I'm not doing this out of greed. I need the gold to fuel my magical furnace. Gold makes the enchanted fires burn clean and hot. Without the gold I can't forge or upgrade weapons."
"I haven't really been here long enough to learn anything. I've been concentrating on restocking my inventory and upgrading weapons for those who need them."
"Questions aren't really my strength, but I'll do my best to help you out."
"Nothing more than what you've already heard, I'm sure. I hear she used to be one of the Matron Mothers from Menzoberranzan, but that might just be a rumor."
"All I know is that her army will crush us all if we don't find a way to stay united against her. I just hope House Maeviir is smart enough to realize this."
"Well, it used to be the ancestral home of House Maeviir. But since we moved in - I mean the Seer and her followers - it's more like a refugee camp."
"As you can imagine, there's a lot of tension here. Most drow don't like the followers of Eilistraee, and House Maeviir is no exception. They don't have much choice, though."
"If we don't band together, the Valsharess will sweep us all away. If we can stay united, then at least we'll have a chance. Or so the Seer says."
"I came here with the Seer, but I'm not a follower of Eilistraee. Not everyone who follows the Seer shares her religious convictions."
"Some of us are just drow fleeing the Valsharess. Several of the powerful drow Houses have been all but wiped out by her army, leaving the handful of survivors to get by however they can."
"My story's nothing special. I started learning my craft at a young age, and my skills quickly brought me to the attention of Matron Usala of House Zarosta in Ched Nasad."
"But when the Valsharess first came to power, House Zarosta refused to join her... a big mistake. The Valsharess wiped out the entire house. For all I know, I'm the only survivor."
"During my flight from Ched Nasad, I encountered some followers of Eilistraee. They took pity on me and brought me to the Seer, and I've been part of her entourage ever since."
"Didn't I tell you I'm a master craftsman? I can take any weapon and make it better, if you give me enough gold."
"My work is somewhat different from the smiths who pound weapons with giant hammers. I'm a craftsman, an artist. I use my skill and powerful magic instead of brute force."
"Just bring me a weapon, and I can use the magic of my forge to improve it. I can add enchantments. I can imbue it with the powers of fire, ice or lightning. Whatever you need, I can do."
"I see you don't have a weapon ready in your hand right now. If you want your weapon upgraded, you'll have to get it out."
"I see you've got a weapon right there in your hand. Would you like me to upgrade it?"
"Not a problem. What would like me to do to your <CUSTOM9809>?"
"Your <CUSTOM9809> already has that property. I'd just be wasting your gold."
"Your <CUSTOM9809> already has that property. I'd just be wasting your gold."
"Your <CUSTOM9809> already has that property. I'd just be wasting your gold."
"Your <CUSTOM9809> already has that property. I'd just be wasting your gold."
"Not a problem. What would like me to do to your <CUSTOM9809>?"
"Is there anything else I can do for you?"
"Your <CUSTOM9809> already has that property. I'd just be wasting your gold."
"Your <CUSTOM9809> already has that property. I'd just be wasting your gold."
"Your <CUSTOM9809> already has that property. I'd just be wasting your gold."
"Your <CUSTOM9809> already has that property. I'd just be wasting your gold."
"Your <CUSTOM9809> already has that property. I'd just be wasting your gold."

"Your <CUSTOM9809> already has a damage upgrade. I'd just be wasting your gold."
"Your <CUSTOM9809> already has a damage upgrade. I'd just be wasting your gold."
"Sorry, but it looks like you don't have enough gold. I need the gold to fuel the fires of my magic furnace. Only gold burns hot and clean enough for me to work my magic."
"Behold a master at work."
"Your <CUSTOM9809> already has a damage upgrade. I'd just be wasting your gold."
"Sorry, but it looks like you don't have enough gold. I need the gold to fuel the fires of my magic furnace. Only gold burns hot and clean enough for me to work my magic."
"Behold a master at work."
"Your <CUSTOM9809> already has that property. I'd just be wasting your gold."
"I'm not doing this out of greed. I need the gold to fuel my magical furnace. Gold makes the enchanted fires burn clean and hot. Without the gold I can't forge or upgrade weapons."
"What are you doing here?"

"Goodbye."

"Let me see your inventory."
"I'm trying to save you all! Can't you give me a deal?"
"I want to ask you some questions."
"How do I get a weapon upgraded?"
