---------- Random Pop-Ups Start Here ------------
"What? Ye're thinkin' of bloody running off without me, are ya?"
"Fine, fine. I won't stand around forever, though, just so ya know."
"Alrighty. I think I can find my own way back. You can find me there if ya needs me again."
"What is it ya want me to do?"
"Really? Well... if you're sure..."
"Sure enough, I'll do my best."
"Stop the creepin' and start the runnin'. I hears ya."
"Right! Stealthy it is!"
"Then what do ya have me around for?" He shrugs. "Suit yerself."
"Aye, it's only natural you'll need my help wi' that stuff."
"An' just how far does ya want me to stand away?"
He shrugs. "Fair enough, I guess."
"Just run right in there? Alrighty!"
He nods. "I'll try me best."
"Well, alright. But don't get bloody grabby or anythin'."
"Oh, aye. I'll take a look through your pack... and I promise not to take anything extra for myself, ha ha!"
"One extra shadow, coming up!"
"Right-o! Just don't leave me behind accidentally, aye?"
"Talk? What about?"
"It's all jus' peachy. Couldn't be better. Well... I could be fabulously wealthy and surrounded by a harem o' buxom halfling lasses... but I don't expect you ta provide that anytime quick, ha ha ha!"
"Anything else special ye want t' discuss?"
"Bit o' gas." His eyes go wide and suddenly he lets out a giant belch. "Aw, there we go. Never mind."
"Why're ye botherin' yerself with me? Get on, you."
"Fine, fine. Just composin' me memoirs in me head, is all."
"Not too bad. I'm thinkin' of joinin' a circus, maybe, when I get back to civilized life. What do ya think of that?"
"I could use a larger share of the bloody loot, if you're offerin'. Heh."
"Think I got a boil on me arse, but otherwise than that, everything's dandy."
"It'd be fine an' well enough. Could ya tell me if it's just real dark... or am I actually blinded? I'm a bit concerned, ya know."
"Pfeh, don't worry about me none. Just a few scratches, nothin' more."
"Just got a bit messed up back there, heh. Nothin' ta see here."
"Just... got a few scratches an' such. Nothin' to worry about." He winces and attempts to hold in the severe bleeding of his abdomen with a free arm.
"Oy! It's all fine an' dandy, except for the liquid fire I got runnin' through me veins. I expect that'll... work itself out..."
"Not too bad, except for these weird splotches on me skin an' such. Ya suppose that's a bad thing?"
"I'm workin' on just bein' a Shadowdancer at the moment. Ya want me to change that?"
"I'm workin' on just bein' a rogue, at the moment. Ya want me to change that?"
"That's what I'd prefer anyway. Sure thing."
"If ya like. I split my time between pickin' up me roguish skills and workin' at being a Shadowdancer. I can focus on one o' those things exclusive-like, if ya prefer."
"Don't change anything? I can do that."
"Right. Shadowdancer it is."
"Fair enough. I'll work on being just a rogue, fer now."
"Hmmm... yeah, I guess they're not so common, aye? Just let me put it this way... there's folks who can hide and there's folks who become one with the shadows."
"Us Shadowdancers, we're the ones who do the latter. Just don't ask me why we does it, 'cause I'd have ta kill ya then. Ha ha ha!"
Tomi thinks about it for a moment, his brows furrowing. "Hmmm. With all the reward money, ya mean? I were thinkin' of taking a vacation. Maybe goin' up ta Icewind Dale."
"I hears there's some goody-two-shoes drow elf up there who needs 'is arse kicked. Sounds like a fun enough vacation ta me."
"See? Now we're gettin' somewhere. Ye're alright."
"Pffft. Never happen. I'm Tomi Undergallows, or haven't ya heard?"
"Well, there ya go. An' besides, how tough could he be? It's not like he's Elminster or some such, sheesh."
"Yeah, I've heard that before. What do ya want me ta do? Head to the Moonshaes an' sit on some beach? What kind o' fun is that?"
"Ya mean before the little misunderstandin' between me an' Lord Nasher?"
He shrugs. "Well, ya did ask." Whistling happily, he skips on ahead.
Tomi shrugs. "Aw, it were nothing so big, if ya asks me. I'd had a few investments go sour, ya see, an' another opportunity came up. I didn't have the coin on hand, however."
"Well, I was going to replace the money in the Treasury with the profits. With interest, even! Old Nasher didn't see it that way, o' course."
"Naw. I were just encouraged ta leave. Big difference with that, ya know."
"Right after the plague ended, though, hmmm... well, back then Tomi opened up chain o' businesses he did. Was right profitable, too."
"Well, maybe it were more of a club. The members paid dues an' in return I let *them* do their business."
"Pfft. Now ye're soundin' just like that Aarin Gend fella who served Nasher, all serious an' such. So it were a guild, it didn't hurt no-one. Well... no-one we weren't paid to."
He throws his hands up in disgust. "Fine, fine! Tomi Undergallows is the most terrible halfling ta ever grace Faerun! Are ya happy now? Sheesh."
He looks around. "But what are we chattin' for? We're down here to adventure, aren't we? Get yer butt in gear, already."
"Not so good. There were the original thieves' guild that sort o' took exception ta mine. I guess they never heard o' live an' let live, aye?"
"They sent eight assassins after me before they finally gave up. By that time I'd decided it just weren't worth it. Aw, well."
"The old fart who runs the bloody city, that's who. I tells ya... don't do anything to get the city riled up, 'cause he'll feed ya to the lions. Spineless old dog, that one."
"Oh, aye. That's not where I came from originally, but it's been good enough fer now. I'm somethin' of a hero there, too... ya heard of the plague, right?"
"Aye, well, I was one o' the folks that helped Lady Aribeth ta deal with that. Of course, nobody remembers the poor lass for that any more."

"You'd think that'd be the case, but naw. Ever since the plague, there's been a couple of... misunderstandings. Tomi had to get on outta Neverwinter, he did. Kinda made coming ta Waterdeep an easy decision."
"I don't know. Why ain't ya surprised? I've never done anythin' to make anyone upset in me whole life."
"But enough about stinky ol' Neverwinter. I'm a Waterdeep halfling now. Let's get on with, errr... what were we doing? Are we saving the city or what?"
"Right! On to save the city!"
"Bah. Same old smelly place it was before. And is it my fault Lord Nasher doesn't understand the difference between borrowin' some coin from the Treasury and stealin' it? Nope, it ain't."
"Ya mean the Hero of Neverwinter? Aye, <he/she> was there, too. You remind me o' <him/her> a little bit, ya do."

"If ya asks me, they give that <lad/lass> a bit too much credit, an' not enough to the little folks... an' certainly not any at all fer Lady Aribeth after what she did. That's just the way things go, aye?"
Tomi thinks for a moment, scratching his chin. "Ya know... I can't rightly say. Went on ta other adventures is my guess."
"Oh. She were this pretty little filly, a paladin that served Lord Nasher... the bloke who runs Neverwinter. It was her duty ta fight the plague."
"Aye, ye've heard of her? She were this paladin that Lord Nasher told ta fight the plague. She's the one that found the Hero of Neverwinter... if ya heard about that one, too, I dunno."
"Anyway, she eventually turned against the city. Fell from grace, painter 'er armor black... the whole bit. Sad, really. Though I hear her new armor was damned fetching."
For once, an expression of real sadness crosses the halfling's eyes and he looks away from you. "Dead," he grudgingly says. "It weren't right, but... I guess it had ta be."
"I liked her well enough. Funny how nobody ever blames Lord Nasher for drivin' her to it all. I'd sure tell him so, if I ever saw him again."
"I'm not just going ta bloody well stand around forever... but alright. I'll stay here for now."
"Right-o! Off we go!"
"Too busy ta chat with the fella who watches your back, hey? Fine, fine, Tomi'll remember that, he will."
"Right, then. Please forgive the humble Tomi Undergallows for offending your divine personage with anything other than prayer. I should bloody well know better."
"Right, then. I apologize for my base crassness and attitude. I am unworthy of addressing a respectable personage such as yourself."
"Right, then. 'Oh, yer magnificent Highness, m'<Lord/Lady>. Might this lowly mealworm have a word with ye?"
Tomi frowns, rolling his eyes. "Alright, then. Have it yer way, sheesh."
"So ya figure I should poke ya with a dagger next time?"
"Right, then. Next time I'll just whip off me bloody shorts and flag ya down."
"So what's rude about it? Did I say 'Listen up, cow!'? No, I don't think so."
"That's not rude. I could'a just pinched yer arse if I needed yer attention."
"How much coin do ya got, anyways?"
"It's just that I got this... investment opportunity I knows about, aye?" He looks about, suspicious, and leans in closer. "Lemons."
"Shhhh! Not so loud! Aye, lemons! It's this little yellow fruit that comes from Maztica, the sourest thing ya ever did taste, they is."

His eyes grow distant as he becomes suddenly animated. "Just think of it! It could become the fashionable new fruit, loved by nobles everywhere and served at buffets! And... and it can clean greasy messes, too!"
"Let's not get silly, aye? Anyway, what do ya think?"
"Importing bloody lemons from Maztica! We'll make millions, we will!"
"You like the idea?" He seems surprised. "My pitch must be getting better. Hmmm... now to just survive all this Undermountain business..."
"What? Ya can't ask about a friend's finances, aye?"
Tomi frowns thoughtfully. "Fine, then. Suit yerself." He casts an eye at your belt pouch, but says no more.
"You ever been to Calimshan? I've been thinkin' lately just how familiar you look."
